QcwqGlvqB33j5pMmvyWwpA.text: This hole in the wall was my first taste of Phoenix.  I came up to the front and asked the guy what was in the Machaca burrito.  That's a legit question, right?  He looks at me like I'm crazy, then starts naming things off slowly...   him: "you wanna know what's IN the burrito?" me: "yeah" him: "ummm, machaca, beans, cheese"  me: "nothing else?" him: "ummmm, naaaa"  Well, I got it, not really any beans in it, and there was a liquid that looked cheesy, but not sure if it was actual cheese.  It did have some sort of sauce though and plenty of meat.  Overall, cheap and not bad, but also fell apart too easily.  It needs a stronger tortilla.

1r4sMnDx1v6Hj4f_fWNGhw.text: Ok, so Mexican food isn't the prettiest in photographs but I promise you this place is awesome. Not to be confused with the Carolina's chain; this original spot is delicious, real Mexican food served up on cheap, yellow trays in a no-frills cafeteria-style seated area.

47s0z2f1Pk4mr2HqajjdSw.text: This was my first time being here and the service was quick yet after I ate my shredded beef burrito with cheese, rice and beans.  I loved the tortillas, I swear they have the best ever!!!!!   However I ended up enjoying my burrito for only about an hour then my body was not pleased with it and i puked it all up.

yefy7VC4z-8kETbVAK2WXA.text: It's OK.    I hate to always be bitching about Mexican food in the Valley, but what can you do?  It's a disgrace.  The fact that this place appears to be some kind of Holy Grail of Mexican food here in Phoenix just seems to emphasize that point.  Let's deal with the food first.  This isn't really Mexican food. It's Tex-Mex food.  That means you've got your choice of tacos, burritos, tostadas, enchiladas, chimichangas, etc.    We tried the "Oaxaca" burro (massive air quotes around the "Oaxaca" part of the name), which was just fine, but very, very small.  I mean seriously, i'ts beans, cheese, potatoes and a bit of chorizo - we're not talking ahi tuna here.  Why not give a normal sized portion?  We tried the menudo which was delicious but again, a miniscule portion. And they can't even be bothered to give you a plastic bowl, so you have to eat it out of the styrofoam to go container.  I mean, for F's sake, they give me a plastic bowl at my favorite taco truck.    Still hungry, we ordered a combination plate, which was the same sort of tex-mex crap that you can get pretty much anywhere in town.  Not so great.  It was all fine for what it is (I guess) but nothing that I would particularly go out of my way for, with the exception of the homemade flour tortillas, which were awesome.  I even bought some to go.  And that's about it for the food.  Now as to the restaurant itself, it's actually pretty disgusting, to the point where one has to conclude that they are just showing contempt for the customers.  The place is filthy.  The bathrooms, in particular, are vile. As Tony Bourdain says, "I may not be able to look in the kitchen but I can check out the bathroom and that let's me know how much they care about the restaurant." Uh, exactly!   And the answer in Carolina's would seem to be, "not very much."  The surly and uninterested staff add to that special ambiance.   We eat in lots of small ethnic restaurants and just because a place is "in the hood" doesn't mean it has to be gross.  Our favorite Salvadorean restaurant is in the hood but it's also hospital clean, which makes me pretty confident that the kitchen is also clean.   Finally, the neighborhood.  LOL.  To describe this street as "in the hood" is an insult to "hoods" everywhere.  This street is one of the most blighted streets I've ever been on, anywhere.  I'm actually thinking of going back there today to do some documentary photos to send to my friends in Cambodia whose visions of America are mostly derived from CSI Miami.  Seriously, it's appalling.  The main thing I was thinking about driving away from there is that the Phoenix city government needs some kind of federal intervention.  So would I eat there again?  Yeah, probably, if I was in the neighborhood.  Would I go out of my way to drive there?  No way.

Hf8IUNjG83GitPAHWvTpTg.text: So my friend at work told me i should try their food... He said it would be packed by 11 so i got there around 10am.  I ordered the Machacha Plate but i really wanted a machacha breakfast... it was good.  I think i will try the burrito next time and hopefully that will be the ticket.  The machacha plate was good the meat was slightly salty, the beans and rice were good also... i like the tortilla though! it made the food better... i just like tortillas when they are placed over open fire i guess.

nayzjX0c6z15Pu6Wj3sn4Q.text: I was so upset about this place that I had to write my first review today.  I went to Carolinas today and placed my order.  I waited for about 15-20 minutes.  People who ordered after me started to get their food.  So I went up to the counter to the lady calling out numbers and giving the food to the people.  She couldn't find my order.  She was starting to tell the cooks to make my order but at this point I asked for my receipt back because I wanted my money back.  The girl said without being apologetic that I needed to go over to where I ordered to get my money back.  So I went back to the guy who took the order and asked for my money back.  He didn't ask what happened just opened the cash register and handed me money.  No apologies from anybody or acknowledgment of the fact that we waited and had no food.  I think this place has okay food but I will never go back because this food isn't SO great that I need to deal with the service that doesn't care about keeping customers happy.  There are much better places that I don't fear food poisoning from that are really nice to their customers.  I say the previous sentence because people who have been the place know that it isn't the nicest place.  In fact, it is the worst looking place that I have ever seen.  I can't believe I've eaten here in the past due to the way it looks.

MEOxtY18tLVYZfpZoYPobw.text: This is coming from a Hispanic woman very proud of her own home cooking. I make my own tortillas, beans, etc.. Consider the fact that I am a huge fan of my own cooking as you read this review.   Normally, this is a pretty good joint. It's not bad if you're jonesing for a taco or some really good beans (and don't want to make it yourself). It is considerably tastier than any Filiberto's, and more authentic tasting than places like America's Taco shop.   My faves are the butter-soaked tortillas, bean burritos, and chicken tacos. I keep it simple in simple joints. Today, unfortunately, it wasn't even close to as flavorful as it usually is. It wasn't worth the hour I put in at the gym afterwards.   But hey! Normally it is worth a stop, especially if one is deprived of Mexican food at home.

Qvi-qv5TjstHxxBZ5cWzRA.text: The reason to come to Phoenix! I love this place- quite authentic and honest. My favorite is the chorizo and potatoes with tortillas. Spicy, salty deliciousness. We bought tortillas to take home- they are worth the trip alone. Slightly salty with that perfect puerco after bite. And the fountain sodas have that perfect tiny slushy ice and strong coca cola. I give Carolina's two thumbs up.

JDAjY2-KZfV_GeZoWS7OUA.text: If you aren't afraid of the atmosphere you'll probably like this. Not for anyone that has any diet restrictions. But man was it packed and cheap. I felt like we had found the Dallas Buyers Club of z Mexican Food.

KXEV8AK0xE4yb0vyY2njyQ.text: After reading some less than flattering reviews of Carolina's, I thought I would come to the defense of this iconic Mexican restaurant in downtown Phoenix, named after the kind owner. You see, I was craving some good Mexican after this bowl of cheap ice cream I just had for dinner (don't ask), and harkened back to a time when I'd frequent Carolina's while working in Phoenix in the 90's.   I think I have the bad reviews figured out, save for the gal whose rear end turned into a fire hose: The people were SCARED of the place, the area, everything. Yes, Carolina's is what you would call a dive, with a capital D. And, it is in the HOOD. I mean no disrespect by that, it's just what it is. When you consider the whole package- the neighborhood, the building, signage, interior, etc. it could definitely put some people off who are not used to such a thing. I mean, I understand, because I'm a guy, I'm not small, and the first time I went there I thought I'd be gunned down or kidnapped by MS-13 or something. Seriously, driving there I was aghast as I had never seen people in the US living in 40 year old, busted up cabover campers sitting on the dirt, with plywood shacks surrounding them. Not kidding.  But the food, the handmade flour tortillas, it's divine. When somebody cries that their soft taco just didn't hit the spot, I wonder WTF they were expecting. Maybe Taco Bell? How about get an imagination and order the Machaca Beef and Bean Burro and turn into an absolute wild animal because you can't eat it fast enough? That's what I'm talking about.

JmAKJjYuqM4VtKRBYJ8Q1Q.text: Had some tamales, and they were one of the worst I have ever had! There is no way this place is the best in town? Now I am not condemning this place, I will come back and give them another try. I will try something different and maybe I might change my mind. But I just don't get the hype!

mfm7lIPFbbpNUiFmzKZ1Gg.text: Gorged on green Chile and machaca meat tacos, but the salsas were what made the meal.  The red salsa that came with chips was outstanding, hot but with a slowly increasing burn.  The salsa available from the dispensers by the soda machines was subtly different with more heat and a more acidic feel.  I love rat hole Mexican and this may be the best I've ever had.

yYIC8A2jStGAv7H_K4DltQ.text: They ruin an otherwise good taco by putting terrible cheese and terrible lettuce on it. The tamale I had was great... But I wouldn't come here for just that. As good as the butter tortilla sounds... I'll pass.  5 stars for the tamale... 1 star for the tacos. 3 overall.

nVHNj3NJtj7pGxFEjiOpVQ.text: The tortillas are like air. The filling is allowed to shine whilst encased in a delicious light tortillas. Cheap eats. My first stop from the airport every time. Machaca and eggs.

gllCQYY2CDVbWKxweD-U7Q.text: If the reviews were based strictly on food, Carolina's would get 5 stars. My brother and his family took us there for the "best Mexican food in Phoenix". I wouldn't have gone if it wasn't for my family's experience there. It's in a sketchy neighborhood and looks really run down, but looks can be deceiving. The food was amazing!

inzR2KZbm-oOXknPq6PooQ.text: Best Mexican food ever.  Don't mind the bullet holes in the building.  Burritos and the most amazing chewy burrito perfection I've ever had.  The shredded beef melts in your mouth.  We placed a to go order and had to go back in for more.  Been thinking about it ever since.

hCx1_hmNQlPz1_qmjFuTzw.text: Delicioso!  I LOVE mexican breakfast food.  Carolinas is not only for breakfast (their tamales are to die for too) but breakfast is what I can most accurately RAVE about at Carolinas.  Get the MACHACA!  Delicous beef 'ish' meat wrapped in homemade tortillas... still warm and stretchy!   I finally physically went to Carolina's today and its great and to the point.  Order at the counter and its ready for you in a split second.  They have AWESOME SALSA in the 'eating area' to smother your machaca etc. with.   So yummy.    Its quite busy inside which is a fair representation of how scrumptious Carolina's is!  A True mexican food gem downtown.... which is nice to actually find because there are SO many choices... but CHOOSE CAROLINAS! :)

93FW0pz5un4LLj_Ca9R14g.text: Hands down the best Mexican food you will find ! The tortillas are huge and you can buy them for home ! The place is a whole in the wall but well worth stopping for , it's super close to the airport so be sure to stop by either after or before u get to the airport

9gqmivyXGRwXwbqZaWC1LA.text: Get food to go.  Tacos are excellent, the fresh made tortillas are to die for

ecQCUtfGUPHZtjVBHaefwQ.text: Awesome and authentic food. No frills- just delicious. Buy some homemade tortillas to take home!

QbgLHKdsL1ygdx2NeXqpJA.text: So after doing an internship in Downtown Phoenix, I was introduced to Carolina's. I was a little apprehensive at first, but I had heard many rants and raves about this hole and had to try for myself. After my first bite of Carolina's burrito, I was in love. It was awesome, and I continued to sample many of the items on Carolina's menu for the remainder of my internship, never once disappointed. I even brought home some of their famed tortillas - just those warmed with a little butter - simply melts in your mouth goodness. Awesome and cheap too!

hO7QDtMPeMkrcUwMauuwAw.text: Best tortillas in AZ!  Carolinas is a fast food type mexican joint that is cranking out the best tortillas in our state.  The food ranges from bean and cheese burros, shredded beef tacos, menudo on the weekends, to chimichangas.  Everything is made to order.  There is usually a long line but it goes fast.  They have a simple but delicious red salsa with pumps and cups to take home.  I usualy stick to basic bean and cheese burritos and shredded beef tacos and load up on the salsas to go.  There are 3 locations now.  One in Peoria, Cave Creek, and the original on Mohave.  All of the locations have been on par.

HUPC4hlKWMrMdSOqabCuaw.text: i was excited about trying Carolina's as the reviews were great but I have to say I was really disappointed.  First, it is not a restaurant per se but a fast food place where one orders from the counter.  Oh well, that is OK if the food is good but the menu was much like a Taco Bell with very little variation (tacos, burritos, chimichangas, etc.).  I ordered the beef enchiladas but to begin with I was really put off by all the styrofoam, everything was on styrofoam, the drinks, and the meal even if you were eating inside and then plastic forks.  No chips and salsa to start with just styrofoam!!  Then I had to take it back as they gave me chicken enchiladas even though it was marked correctly.  With that, I was looking forward to the meal but it was just 'blah', it was OK, nothing was wrong with it just not very flavorful (maybe it was the styrofoam! JK).  On the pro side, they were busy but got the order out quickly and they were nice enough.  However, if you are looking for a 'restaurant', this is not it, and you can pick up something on your lunch hour quickly and take it wherever but certainly not a dining experience so go with that in mind but there are too many good flavorful Mexican restaurants to go to than to hit Carolina's except for quickness and grab and go.

p856WEyaDcpR6kF51zhr4Q.text: Now that I work so close to Carolina's.... I have been back 3 times within 2 1/2+ weeks!!  :)  Ah that red chile (add cheese) burrito and a taco duro!  YUM!  Make sure you get some tortilla's to go!

yvyl1gMT6x3Zv_rRTX-GMg.text: One of the best Mexican restaurants I've been to in Phoenix.  Everything I've ever had here was good, except the guacamole.  The guac is bland and uninspiring.

B_hnb9iZO4cGhx71xNHR1Q.text: Best tortillas around!  Authentic and amazing green chili, looking forward to next visit!

sK9yBjS4-w4rYftstu5YIQ.text: Best of PHX.  Authentic food in a neighborhood with no pretension.  Treat yourself.

f3hGvSDU8JbXFEklq38p0w.text: Machaca Burro is ridiculous and the butter tortilla will take you to the promised land

ZcusXxXuP4NdO_rfjAWA7w.text: holy guacamole! i just got back from getting my burrito, i loved it so much i couldn't wait to review it.   i got a machaca burrito. it comes w/ just cheese but i asked for beans as well. OMGosh! i took one bite and i was in love. seriously. i'm going to have a big problem b/c i am going to be craving these burritos and they're just too far away from my home :'(   homeade torillas, shredded beef seasoned just right, refried beans and cheese. so simple but so good!!!!! i will be back before i go home that's for sure! yummy!

RmB1qcceAf345IrzgJnp8w.text: On our way to PHX, we stopped off here for a quick lunch. What a surprise! In an interesting part of town, this place is amazing. The menu seemed very typical of Arizona mexican cuisine. The #10 Enchilada plate was delicious and the #5 Mechaca plate was incredible. For two people, we were easily out the door for under $15 with plenty of food. Definitely not a frilly atmosphere but the food is great, tortillas are made fresh out back and I can't wait to go back for more.

BOXU17n5ttWO8HUKAbcuQA.text: Great food, but I had a problem with the cleanliness of the dining area.  While the food was great the seating was rough and there was never a clean table available.  The floor had food remnants all over it and I wasn't excited to stay and eat there.  I sat in my car outside and ate there.  Like I said, I enjoyed the food but without the restaurant experience.  I'll be back for takeout soon.

SsWdILeXOFSjIWQdZzF8xQ.text: This is the best Mexican food I have ever had... There tortillas are the best in town! 5 stars

HZPJELmOQpZRnH_JQ_5IYQ.text: great food..great prices!! As stated by everyone this place is the bomb. Great sauces and tortillas!! Yummy!!

83_PXrmegPqpGxwAfTc9FA.text: Best tortillas in AZ is not a slogan. It's the truth. It's worth the trip every time. I go to this place everytime I  am in town. Chorizo is amazing! They sell it to take home too

DZN8zr9or4FixL00Biu7Qg.text: carolinas, your enchiladas ruined it for me.  i can't imagine eating another one of your soggy tortillas swamped in a pool of the most horrifying enchilada sauce my taste buds have ever met. mole overload and non-existent chile. lacking any real taste to it whatsoever.  disappointed.

l7ouyJUyrZO2X6ldag2xTQ.text: Best Mexican food in the valley for the money!  Location is in a not so good part of town but a lot of local police and fireman eat there during lunch time during the week.  The tortillas are made fresh and you end up wanted to take some home with you.  The red chili burro is very good and the rice and beans is so fresh it makes your mouth water thinking about it!  There is a line during the week so be prepared but the food is ready in no time.  Staff is very nice and friendly, food is hot and fresh, not too bad!

X_9Hm4fq6ODsa5bT3jQJlw.text: I love my Mexican food dripping with grease and this place does the trick. They do everything right on their menu. It is a great place for lunch when you work downtown. It gets pretty busy so call your order ahead. You won't be disappointed.

caOPkJ7LE8OcjBjqIN0aoA.text: My girlfriend took me here when I came to town, after discovering that Ritos was closed for the week, and it was all that I had hoped for: Absurdly delicious, freshly made flower tortillas.  I opted for the Oxaca Special burrito (beans, rice, chorizo, and cheese) and was not disappointed. The salsa is fantastic.  I loved the hole-in-the-border fence decor, and especially loved the buttered tortillas.  You can't find Northern Mexican like this in LA, folks.

shM52mx1srWWJBvYbQP0Kg.text: Best Mexican Fast Food in town! Love the Oaxaca burrito, tortillas to go (great with butter!). Other recommendations are the chicken burrito (very juicy!), and the machaca plate. It's all good! Service is fast, so don't worry if there's a line when you walk in. It's normal. I usually order to go...avoid the restrooms at all cost. If you must go, expect the same experience as a "Honey Bucket" (very gross!). If you want to dine in, go to the Shea location. The food is the same but bathrooms are much cleaner!

s1LQEGAxBDWsYnZbuXmyPQ.text: Carolina's is a great lunch spot that is the closest thing Phoenix has to an LA-style tacqueria - hole in the wall location, minimal decor, iffy neighborhood and great Mexican food.  Pretty much everything I've had there is great, though a friend of mine swears by their enchiladas.    It gets packed around noon and stays that way until 1:15 or so and my favorite time to go there is around 2 to cram my face until 3 and pass out at my desk until 6.

APyd2nWtPIw6xQzetwig6g.text: hollllly hell, this place is hands down the best mexican food restaurant in Arizona! Their tortillas are bomb and so is everything else on the menu! And you won't break the bank, place is CHEAP! looking forward to visiting their new location in Mesa.

TXCQxCOa1DMfr6bAXZbYJQ.text: I have to say I would be very pissed if their burritos weren't so good. I tried to call in my order for over 30 minutes. Either it's busy or just rings and rings.  I get to the downtown location and now I know why. They don't bother to answer the phone.   Don't waste your time trying to call in an order because they aren't picking waste your time waiting 30 minutes for a small takeout order....

9vZdpMHqaK1q-jc57TuEJQ.text: Visiting Phoenix for the first and we were craving Mexican as soon as we got off the plane. This spot exceeded our expectations! Authentic, delicious, and well priced! Would definitely come back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Taco and enchilada combination...you won&#39;t regret it!
Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ordered the combination- tacos and enchiladas

F5C56eeTwkuZ_DeAx8LwSQ.text: Gotta love Carolina's! 3 way burro is amazing, red and green chili and beans. There machaca taco are awesome too. This place is just a local gem.

Vd5s6IqJ3VwHU8ioq1LiAQ.text: I have eaten at this location a few times but mostly have called in for pickup. Their tortillas are great so I'll mostly order a burrito. Yesterday I was in the area for training so I was not able to call in a pickup order. I was only about a half mile away and had 40 minutes for lunch. I figured five minutes to get there, five minutes to drive back, I'd have 30 minutes to order and eat. BIG MISTAKE. After waiting 25 minutes for the burrito I ordered and paid for, they still hadn't managed to assemble a bean and potato burrito. I had to get back to my training class so I left without my burrito - just a flat Diet Coke in-hand. I definitely will not be ordering and dining in at this location again. Lesson learned.

7UbOC111SPhuMuzm-20MbQ.text: My fiance took me here and I have to admit this is the BEST BURRITO OF MY LIFE! It was so simple yet the ingredients bled together like some sort of magic authentic Mexican symphony. I can't believe how delicious this food was. I didn't go inside the place, I waited in the car - from the looks of the building I was highly skeptical. Then when we got home and I realized there were beans in the burrito and no sour cream -  I was sure I'd end up eating pizza rolls instead - but to my delightful surprise this burrito ended up LITERALLY being the BEST BURRITO IVE EVER EATEN. I am sad it is gone, I will be back!

bq_Q_Co7JzdMhxLHL_FHmQ.text: Burritos are incredible, both breakfast and lunch. You absolutely can't beat the prices for the quality of food. Best Mexican I've had in Arizona. The service is pretty basic but very quick. Do yourself a favor and some some homemade tortillas home with you!

KtrW8vW_bXnLGYtXM8lzWw.text: If aesthetics were a measure of a restaurant's quality, this place would probably get a minus 5 stars.  I've been to tons of dives in my time, but this may very well be the divyest dive I've ever dived headfirst into.  That's not meant to be mean spirited to owner Carolina Valenzuela and her establishment, because in this case its part of the charm of a legendary Mexican establishment that I finally got the chance to try for the first time.  What this place lacks in aesthetics, it more than makes up for with its fantastic food.  The original Carolina's location is just south of Downtown on 12th Street.  Its an old weathered building that looked like it could've been a pawn shop or a tire dealer in a past life.  I think its fair to say the neighborhood surrounding the restaurant is somewhat impoverished, though theres a fair amount of industrial business nearby too.  Let's just say that Carolina's building blends in with the neighborhood.  That said, you'll be waiting in line forever at lunch as this place gets jam packed during the work week.  I opted to come here after work around 4:30pm.  Still, worried about the lines, I called my order ahead before I arrived.  When I arrived for my pickup?  Dead.  I was the only one there.  Maybe my timing was awesome?  I wasn't complaining as I was able to get in and out in two minutes.  There's a little bit of seating inside, but I was getting it to go this time around.  I decided to get a dozen of their tortillas since everyone seems to rave about those.  As for a meal to take home it seems that the chimichangas are a popular staple, so a beef chimichanga combo it was.  A big hearty beef chimichanga topped with guacamole and sour cream with a side of beans and rice.  Total for the combo plus the tortillas was $13.    The chimichanga is exactly what I was hoping for.  A thick crispy fried tortilla with plenty of shredded beef and spices to boot.  Goes great with the guacamole and sour cream, though the beef is truly the dominant flavor with this one.  The beans were also very good and had some good chunks of bean I could pick up (not a bean puree like other Mexican food spots I've been to).  The rice was pretty much what I expected.  Nothing wow about the rice, but met my expectations.  And the tortillas I got were enormous.  I decided to make a homemade quesadilla with one of them and I'm already stuffed.  But I agree with fellow Yelpers that its worth getting some of their tortillas.  They're made in house (you can see where they make them behind the front counter), and have a much different texture than the stuff you get at the grocery store.  Barrio Cafe remains my favorite Mexican spot in the valley, but comparing Barrio with Carolina's is apples and oranges.  Barrio is essentially gourmet, whereas Carolina's is Mexican for the masses.  Its inexpensive, the quality is excellent, and its been drawing every demographic imaginable for years.  Its not hard to see why Carolina's faithful turn to this dingy location again and again.  You can damn well be sure I'll be one of them.

hXrY0QEpLETbB_oc5dk2eQ.text: I called and spoke with a person regarding catering and left a message with the catering department. I have not heard from anyone. Apparently they have good food and lousy service.

RN0gTwTODfKnX9wfuxfjrA.text: My children were afraid to come in.  "Why are we eating at a place with barbed wire around it?" I heard from their tiny little voices.  After we finished eating they asked, "When are we coming back?"  Yes, the food is very, very good.    - The red enchiladas are probably the best I've had.  Spicy, flavorful sauce with perfect tortillas - The shredded beef tacos were full of juicy meaty goodness - The tostada was ok - The quesadilla was solid - The salsa has a nice balance of bite and breadth - Service is friendly

B_qacpUZlHRv18UcjMYR5w.text: So far the best Mexican food I've had in Arizona, HANDS DOWN.  I've lived in Arizona for 39 years.  Go, go NOW.  Stop reading this and go, NOW.

x0gtVLoDvkBYsVgovyIc2w.text: Its just OK.  The tortillas are too thin.  They tear easily on your burrito.  Then they charge extra if you want your burrito double wrapped.  Tried it a few times just to give it the benefit of the doubt cause they opened recently at this location in Avondale, but Filibertos down the street may be a better option.

swVAV0TYeaNJDBblZL0LGg.text: Everything on the menu is bomb.com! My favs are the chorizo with papas (potatoes). The chorizo isn't too spicy where you'll have heartburn. And of course the beans & tortillas simple but bomb too. The place itself is in the ghetto & it's a ghetto looking but those are the best, which is why it's not open in the evening. I don't think they have a/c feels like a swamp cooler so avoid dining during summer so maybe do take out. Ladies the bathrooms are really run down so avoid using them,if you can.

_2FYcjR1EWt4sCPv8fBjJA.text: Was in the mood for Mexican food and found this place on Yelp. Everything on the menu is amazing. I'd recommend the green chili w/ bean burrito, tamales, and tacos. I'll be back!

6NYKzXMuNr3zMuNethkA0Q.text: Oh how I love their green machaca burro! So good! I get it double wrapped because it's messy and their tortillas are so good. I've had other things here too and all have been very good, but my heart (and stomach) belong to the green machaca burro. The place is a dive, however. Do not come here for atmosphere! I order ahead and pick it up to eat somewhere else. They often get special orders wrong, so I've learned to check everything before I go. I overlook the atmosphere and inaccuracies because the food is just so darn good! Also you can buy tamales or tortillas by the dozen. Yummmmmm

ipVsdkQW0xv_q8p5k0AkKg.text: great food.  love the green chile burro, tamales, and butter tortilla.  place is a bit of a dive, but have never encountered any problems.  employees are very nice.

hBmVdvGEORk7kDk98WXkGg.text: I've been coming here for 15 years. Great food. Amazing tortillas. My co-workers didn't care as much for the salsa, but I love it. It has a little kick to it, but not too much, and although it's a runny salsa (as opposed to chunky), it has great flavor.  Have I had better Mexican food in my life? Yes. But Carolina's is a place that everyone should try once. It's an institution. I get the #13, which is an enchilada, taco, tostada, rice and beans. Awesome beans and rice. I suggest getting a chicken or beef enchilada rather than the standard cheese enchilada that comes with it.  The last thing I'll say is that a lot of people will look at the location and decide they're not going to go because it's in the middle of a neighborhood in downtown Phoenix. It is not dangerous. I'll rephrase that... It's no more dangerous than going to a chipotle in Gilbert. Cops and firefighters frequent the place, too, so don't let the location keep you from going.

IMYkN_ymQmGqESa5jGstaQ.text: Last time I went to Carolinas, it was a different location (10 years ago), so I just looked it up on Yelp and found ourselves at the Mojave property. So the place is a hole in the wall, and not a good kind of dive that has character. It looks like an old run down mechanics building. The doors and windows are all covered in iron bars and the inside is bare bones with basic seating and not frequently cleaned tables.  However, since Im giving 4 stars I obviously like the food very much. The chimichangas are the best we've ever had. My son over ordered (as always) and we shared both shredded beef and chicken wet with guacamole. We also ordered some tacos.  The food is tasty, and doesn't skimp on the protein. Excellent traditional mexican food. Service is friendly, although not too fast. They make the food to order and there's a line to expect to wait. It's worth it. A trip to Phoenix isn't the same without Carolinas.

3rGseuhXafnm5SaGToqHPg.text: Went here on my lunch break. After 30 minutes of no food and my co-worker having almost completed her meal, I went to the counter to inquire. It was obvious my order had never been entered, and the girl told me it would be "just 5 more minutes." Ten minutes later I finally got my order, which I had to take back to work and eat during a meeting. Nope, never again!

XjCgE-NYL7WRY5k27gNT4g.text: Been going here for years, food is consistent, salsa is the best! Red Chili burro double wrapped, 2 shredded beef tacos and chips and salsa.

yX7gwW16jNqtNR2oBN8fWQ.text: Very disappointed. I'm a regular customer of their Peoria Ave location and think it's the best. Took an out of town friend there last night, as our business has us near downtown. I can look past the neighborhood, and appearance. The counter was disorganized, people just elbowed their to the front of the line in front of others who were waiting to order. Staff behind the counter seemed to want to be somewhere else. Food came out relatively quickly for as busy as they were. Chips were on the edge of of being burned, very hard and unpleasant taste. Hot sauce, tasted watered down, different from what we love at the other store. Food was average at best. Chimichanga over fried, shell was inedible. Filling was just ok. Beans and rice ok. Friends meal, he said it was ok, but I think he was just being polite. Had half a bag of chips left and threw them away, neither of us wanted them. I think I'll stick to the Peoria ave location in the future.

9LaroECEb_GtLI6eurNA3A.text: The best tortillas in town. They remind me of when I was little girl rolling out and cooking fresh tortillas with my grandma. The refried beans are great. It's the real deal. There's just not much more to say.

1dHgVEizxECkHrSmMZUpFw.text: Only have two choices of meats.... Ordered chicken tacos... Garbage taste better. Not Mexican food at all. Rex mex is closer to Mexican food than this place. Not vegetarian friendly at all. Everything is soaked in lard! Enjoy the runny shots my friends!

boI5V4jfVaxSSRnFuAWM9A.text: This place is not about ambience, just amazing American Mexican food at a great price. Outstanding!

8Cf1F72TfawONS7t_iS7yA.text: Seriously unfair how good the tortillas are from Carolinas. Shit gets REAL at lunch time, prepare for long lines, crazy parking, and making new friends at the random seat you may find.   We used to order ahead and pick up during my office days in the Valley. Machaca is solid, bean and cheese burro is up to par, and god help me I would hurt someone for the green chile right now.   Weird location, but don't be afraid white people. It's soo delicious.

D3x5XklFblRDcIcQ7_9xUw.text: Wow! What an amazing place to get a cheap, yet filling and delicious meal. The place serves authentic mexican food with the best tortillas. I had a chimichanga with beef, cheese, guacamole, and sour cream and it was delicious. Also I was not hungry until the end of the day.

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beef chimichanga with sour cream/guacamole

FfeIFvfOXxKSYTbH458M_w.text: I'll tell you what.  That Carolina sure knows how to make tortillas. And machaca.  And burritos with chorizo and potato.  Here's to another 50 years.

ERJW_WacciKupqL_3tPdJw.text: I had a chicken chimi and red chile burro. Both were great!! Don't expect much ambience, this place focuses on the food and only on the food. As far as divey taquerias go, this is the best I've been to.

eC_MFL1t4tYpKRVoD8ZD3w.text: Classic example of people thinking that a hole in the wall place that is super ghetto must be good because it is a secret from everyday society..... NOT.  Tortillas are good but that's where the praise ends. I had a burrito and I swear I could make a better one myself with a can of chicken and enchilada sauce. Throw in microwave. Served! Next time I'll save the 6 bucks.

mbkYIaFRK6o-MRwEeU2ihA.text: WHat can I say about Carolina's?  It isn't pretty nor is it in the nicest part of town.  The service isn't particularly great and there is ALWAYS a line and a wait for your order.  The floors are bare and seating tight so you wonder why it gets four stars?  The answer is simple, the food is absolutely spot on!    There are about a half dozen elderly Mexican women making fresh tortillas at any one time, the kitchen though sparse, turns out food you can't wait to eat and everyone dining seems happy with what is in from of them regardless of having to bump elbows with your neighbors at times.  One of my pre-travel rituals is a red chile chimichanga combo, which comes with rice, bean and a side of shredded lettuce, cheese, sour cream and guacamole.  Let me tell you this, they STUFF that freshly made tortilla with generously sized cubes of beef bathed in a delicious red chile sauce.  Refried beans may be refried beans but these just work, great consistency, texture exactly as it should be and taste "just like momma would make" (if momma was Mexican!)  I'm a fan of Carolinas and though you don't start to find "frills" in restaurants until you head several mies North or East, I make it a point to take visiting family or friends by to taste some of the best Phoenix has on offer.

a0b_aJj42nDly45KZk6rOA.text: We hopped off the plane in Phoenix hungry for something good. After consulting Yelp for Mexican food nearby we decided on Carolina's  since it has tons of reviews. Wow, what the heck is going on in Phoenix? I can't believe how overrated this place is.  I'm no snob. I will eat at a dive if the food is good but Carolina's is dirty, the neighborhood is sketchy and the food was really bad. I can't imagine how anyone could think the food at Carolina's tastes good. Did I order the wrong thing(chicken tacos)? I think not because my friends ordered other items and they were equally bad. The tortillas were stale and the chicken was so bland. It tasted like they threw some chicken in a crockpot unseasoned and cooked the heck out of it. I feel bad for Arizonans if this is what they consider to be good food.

IpaxXZbUbQeB59KlzN0ixw.text: The food here was cheap and awful. The restaurant itself is poorly kept and uncomfortable. I will never eat here again. I would suggest only getting tortillas here if anything. Avoid the burritos and enchiladas honestly just a salty goopy consistency mediocre at best. I would not recommend this food to anyone.

9f4NYID19im0eXuvu-Z_8g.text: My favorite Mexican Restaurant near downtown Phoenix.  Neighborhood just adds to the flavor of this place.  I just wish I loved closer so I could eat here more and have access to the freshly made tortillas.

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Carolina&#39;s Chimichanga with Guacamole and Sour Cream. Mmmm.
Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Chimichanga. Mmmmm.

m_hYB99QC4wYVz7sIOJ-cQ.text: Great Mexican food with a friendly staff.  Looks small from the outside, but has plenty of room for dine in inside.  Agree that the homemade tortillas are awesome.  Brought some home for my family (as I am GF I couldn't try them, but they reported they were awesome).  They have a great selection of food, my favorite was machaca and eggs. Just moved to AZ and live in East valley, but am back here everytime I am in area (3xs so far in 2 months).  Highly recommend.

ClNODTwOyAXjVqB2hoUQuA.text: Amazing burritos with freshly made flour tortillas. Try the Carne Asada the California or the Chile Relleno burrito. I go to the location near Thunderbird and Cave Creek in Phoenix.

Uwdt92alLm7CS3O1CdJL6A.text: I just dont get what the big fascination with this place...  It's mediocre at best...  I've had their beef hard shell tacos which are quiet greasy flavoress half the time.  Breakfast burrito was eh...would i go back willingly no, but if someone was buying me a free meal I couldnt go for it either.

BZQVvYNVpeAZh37-daVeFw.text: Best Tortillas Ever!!  Whenever I am in the vicinity of downtown Phoenix, I make it a point to stop by Carolina's.  Try their 3-way burro, and make it a foot long.  It is awesome.  I also make sure to bring home a dozen of their HUGE tortillas.  The location is horrible, and the place looks a little scary, but you will always find local police, business men & women, and even celebrities eating there.  It's the best hole in the wall Mexican food in the history of the world!

zySueVxEnDwBaXeZHEIYmw.text: I worked  in Phoenix, AZ; and everyone who lives/works in Phoenix knows about Carolina's.  First of all, it is hands down the best Mexican food I have ever had.  Secondly, I could feed my office staff of 9 for lunch for $60. So great food, that everyone enjoyed, and inexpensive.   You can also purchase fresh hand made tortillas, and bring your own container to purchase enchilada sauce.  I would recommend the Cheese Enchilada combo.  This restaurant is one of the few places I miss during the time I lived in Arizona.  It's located in a cinder block building, no frills, and seriously awful neighborhood in Phoenix. There is a parking lot, but it is often full.   When you arrive the line is out the door, everyone from secretaries superior court judge picking up their order.Call your order in for pick up, it's the easiest way not to spend all day in line.

BMoLfega7e2Fyl_Fl96ALw.text: The food here is AMAZING!!!  I don't know what else to say.  This place doesn't have 4 stars and almost 250 reviews for no reason. Carolina's has been around forever and there's a reason for it. It's the best.

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tamales!

5Lmi7p1bEBlllao_MrG7WA.text: These are the best tortillas in the country, hands down.  Nowhere I have ever been can compete.  The place is a total dive, so it's not the most fun place to eat, but the food more than makes up for it.  If you live in Arizona and haven't tried it, it's a crime.

4njuNQr5sM2O5JsfB5EIXQ.text: I now work in a location very close to this place so I have had it on multiple occasions, but always for take out. The breakfast burritos are an office favorite and I now understand why. Throw shredded beef, eggs potatoes and beans in a burrito and you have a tasty meal that keeps you full for hours but may also put you ijn a food coma. 4 stars for the burritos, they really are delicious. 2 stars for the service, twice now they have messed up our pick up order.

e4G2YLteXVdh13A1FAnrCQ.text: Hello, yep still Great..consistent quality, familiar faces. All good. However..Frijoles on Thursday's for me seem to be the best. probably the crew...who knows.

q7arp9qj9oMlbOhEIqd0sA.text: Amazing Mexican food! I always get the #11 beef tamales and they are literally the best I've had! The only thing is it is crazy busy, and during lunch hours you're looking at an easy 30-45 minute wait. It's definitely worth the wait, but I hate that they never answer the phone and we can't order online. Also, the place could use some renovations, but don't let that be the reason why you don't give this restaurant a try!

eRd2aeCjIi11d-fPFFxQ2Q.text: Very cheap prices... AWFUL SERVICE!!! Pay more go some place better.  Very unprofessional staff and the place is dirty

95S7KL5jyBEHdKI_YxyEIg.text: I decided to stop in here for lunch on my way back to the office. Despite the run down building and awful interior it is was very busy. I stole glimpses of other customers good as they were eating and everything looked delicious and appeared to be authentic Mexican food.   I asked the girl in front of me if she had eaten here before and she said not since she was 10 years old and was excited to order her old favorite plate of a chicken burrito with beans and rice. She said the chicken was juicy and delicious. So I ordered a chicken taco and a shredded beef taco to go. (I also ordered a dozen flower tortillas, because you know...flour tortillas!)   The chicken was good but was not my favorite. The shredded beef taco was amazing! Not too greasy, full of flavor with just the basics of cheese and lettuce. They also gave me a side of their red salsa which was garlicky and yummy!   Next time I go (yes,I will be back!) I will try a machaca burrito  or their cheese enchiladas. This place truly is a hole in the wall authentic Mexican food restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu
Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shredded chicken taco with lettuce and cheese
Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Their to go menu

5dTSlLO-KvyCE47xiO3_QQ.text: We landed into Phoenix last night and I have been craving a breakfast burrito with chorizo. I make my own from a recipe that is amazing so my expectations are pretty high. After reading the reviews for Carolina's, I was excited to try the food! Overall, the chorizo breakfast burrito with egg, potato, and beans is just okay. The tortilla is amazing, but the flavor is lacking a lot with the chorizo. The egg is mashed up into the potato, and then the chorizo is mixed up into the egg and potato. The burrito is pretty small too, so for $4.10 it's kind of expensive for a hole in the wall joint. The sauce is just okay as well. I would eat here again but wouldn't become a regular.

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States

NKmBTN7pprp3DzY4kLHbng.text: This is the original Mexican food restaurant in downtown Phoenix everybody that knows about good Mexican food will go there.

5yBmppKKL8u3jJT__SrFrg.text: I have always enjoyed eating here as a kid. Now that I have to place the order, I realize their customer service is so bad. I called and called and called. They didn't answer until the 5th call. When she did answer she seemed so monotoned and like she didn't want to help. Luckily their food is good or else I would not keep coming.

i2zPGJKHTd2GL6UKY6BtOw.text: Dissapointed. No flavor. Not REAL Machaca, just plain ol' shredded beef, that is not Machaca. Granted I have never had REAL Machaca anywhere in the Valley, but when you base your business on Machaca, at least get it right. Tortillas are good, but only when fresh, two days later, not good at all. The search for Authentic Mexican food, outside of my mom's kitchen, continues.   Oh and I'm still looking for the Chorizo in my breakfast burrito, never found it.

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States. That&#39;s flavorless shredded beef. It is not Machaca. Get it right.
Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Where is the Chorizo??

lURlCireVrHSxyUn3Ut6PA.text: Got a 3 way burrito, added rice and it was very good.  My husband got a cheese enchilada and hard taco and both were very good. We have been here several times and have not been disappointed at all. We will definitely continue to come here when we are in the area and have a craving for some good food.

8DfBsDomEmN-L3LKFRevWA.text: My first time at this location.  A perfect blend of great food, excellent service, and reasonable prices.  A family of four can eat for about 20 to 25 bucks and leave full and .  We came at lunch and the line was very long.  To my surprise, we placed our order quickly and our food was ready in about 10 minutes.  You can find fresh salsa at the soda fountain island.  Parking is pretty good even when busy.  Highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Number 13.

j679910WogFtG-cizH1DWg.text: These tacos are FABULOUS! Enjoy the fresh tastes and smells of Mexican cuisine. I ALWAYS order the the soft beef tacos with everything on them. They include shredded beef, lettuce, cheese, and all the house made salsa you would like. The environment is laid back and a little noisy but it is part of the authentic experience. As a native New Mexican I know tacos and when I say these are good I mean they rival any taco out there.

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shredded beef taco on soft corn, wonderful experience!

IXSLfiQehAEfNxay5Wes4A.text: The best flour tortillas I've ever tasted, and delicious red chile sauce. Great food, great prices, but long wait times and not always enough tables in the dining room.

GYowguSa2reK1K1JSX3zCw.text: This is one of the BEST authentic lunch places I have been to thus far!!! The service is great, they make it your way and they keep the place clean. They even make the best tortillas always fresh and not breaking my pocket all at the same time.

A7cQcpFe9e6z64Ym-ZdT-w.text: The best tortillas I've ever had. Everything was amazing. Service was friendly and our food was ready super fast. If you want mexican food in Phoenix this place is where you need to go! Even our 10 month old loved it!

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States

X18_UFDrqbiLzNoritnutg.text: The red chili is amazing! Will be back next time we're in town. Great location right next to airport

-eQdVnYq07PUpoxv6Jo6vw.text: The customer service is extremely unacceptable. Providing background content, you must know Carolina's is ALWAYS popping. 9 times outta 10, there's a long line for dine-in and pick-up orders and that's a good sign when searching for bomb, cheap Mexican food. I can accept all the above because I'm ALL about supporting local hole-in-the-wall, Mom & Pop businesses. As much as I love their tortillas, burritos & flavorful red salsa; I'm upset about my recent experience. This review is to provide warning for future customers. Customer service is in need of major improvement!    I placed a phone order for Red Menudo, a quesadilla and 1 chicken/green chilli/rice burrito. Upon arriving the staff at the pick-up window didn't have my receipt order. She took my order over again and placed it for the kitchen. 20 minutes later I decided to speak up since lots of orders placed for guests that arrived way after me got served before me. Remember, my order was easy and quick to fix up. My instincts told me something wrong happened. Here's the fucked up part, I was standing right in front of the register counter the entire time watching for the staff to give me my order. I know they noticed me standing there longer than others but they didn't think to see if I needed help. So I calmly asked for an update on the order and the staff couldn't find it. They asked their co-workers where my order was and the cook said they already placed it out. They looked and looked for about 3 minutes and finally found it on a counter away from where phone orders should be. The staff gave me my order and I said, 'my order has been sitting out while I was waiting. I'm not going to be satisfied, I'd like to speak to the manager.' The staff said, here just take it. It's free. That meal would of cost $12 dollars and that staff's arrangement didn't fulfill my request for a manager. I wasn't pleased with the way my situation was handled. They didn't even get tSo in order to find the light in this situation decided to write this review and asked for a free dozen of flour tortillas (which they gave to me).  Foodies to remember to get your hard-earned money's worth. Yes, their food is bomb but your experience at their establishment should be better than mine. Management, prioritize customer service & satisfaction trainings. As humans, yes mistakes happen and we understand. However, what's the plan to ensure the customer still feels valued after the fact. How can you be better? I'm taking a long break from y'all. The experience was very unpleasant. Por favor, necesitas a cuidar su gente.

mzejRIDIEXl4-T1y000krw.text: Sketchy looking, but not sketchy tasting! Fresh, delicious, and authentic! I was told this is the place where criminals & judges come to put aside their differences, and eat delicious food. All walks of life were in there, and the food was fresh and tasty. Love that horchata! I tried the deep fried burro and a chorizo tostada. So good!

xBjClVh7k9pLzs6YkBHV9A.text: Had saved the name from a year ago ( no idea where I saw or read about it ) Glad I saved it, food was great, enchilada sauce is very good. Service is super fast & we were there at a busy lunch time going on  when we arrived..Definitely would go back next time in Phoenix.  Brought back 4 dozen huge tortillas to share with family in Tucson.

mtKQXchtiCJcJVZzYBL0aQ.text: My coworkers freaked out when I led them to this establishment. Bars on the windows and not in the best neighborhood. After they took their first bite, their minds changed and they calmed down! Carolina's is amazing. I had a fantastic tamale and enchilada combo plate with deliciously seasoned rice and beans. This is the first establishment where I've ever had horchata on tap! Yum.  Don't be scared, try Carolinas!

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States. #2: Enchilada and tamale meal

q-sPrZLyGQwyHc7K3TE3hA.text: What's with the rave about their tortillas? I get it. They're thin, fresh and comes out the foil steaming, but what's so special about them?  The original was tasteless (for obvious reasons). The butter tortilla was just you know...the original slathered in butter.  Most of the food is just carb overload.  The machaca breakfast burrito was pure MUSH.

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Seating area

J4rxQlr7j4AlCvzbdrs9Jg.text: Amazing food!!!  Came back twice during our vacay. Don't let the dilapidated dining area turn you off!  Once you try the food, you won't care!

2UT1JmJbFimwnYU0ay-Afg.text: Authentico! Excellent food. You can tell when you walk into the place that you are about to get the real deal!

V5RSkIoy3jN5BrBUV-L8lQ.text: I don't get it!  I've heard a lot of about this place so I had to try.  At first glance this place gave you one of those uh-huh moments.  Yep, sketchy and a little ghetto I thought.  However, I risked my life for a burrito before!  I ordered the taco platter and my sister had the enchiladas.  I had to get some hot sauce out of the ketchup dispenser, which didn't look too clean, but I took my chances.  I would like to stress "hot" since it seemed like it was just "sauce".  I can't say too much about the taco since it felt like sustenance.  My sister's enchiladas weren't too bad.  Coming from the barrios of LA I definitely had better Mexican food.    The place itself is pretty simple. Basic tables and chairs nothing to wow and pop anybody, but I gather they weren't trying to.  Needless to say I've had better.... much better and I don't think I want to risk my life for this.  -  Enjoy!

J2oH1pBTMrb9muracm63lA.text: Basically anything you order is going to be your favorite! Don't be too sketched out by the area; it adds to the authenticity! I would recommend the chicken chimi or a basic bean and cheese burrito. Awards cover the walls of this place and you know it's good! Be sure to grab a dozen tortillas to go or some salsa by the pint.

JrHkFm-5AswruDgqZ8dS9w.text: I've heard a lot about this place over the ten years I've lived in the valley. I've always wanted to try it and see what all the fuss is about. I've heard several times that they have the best Mexican food in the valley.   I went for lunch during the week and ordered a green chile burrito and a red tamale. The burrito was runny and soggy and the inside was almost like a can if Dinty Moore, the tamale was dry, very little meat, too much masa and didn't taste very good. It was a complete let down after hearing so much over the years and I would say that any local Filabertos has better food after my first visit. I'll give it another shot and that might change my review some.  The other reviews mention it's legacy and the dive location so I'll let them cover that as well as the butter tortillas.

lHzwPAqXPo5oPmCzybny-g.text: Upon arrival at this Phoenix dive, one instantly senses tradition, history, character and the possibilities of something memorable. The food is in take out / fast food style, and the very reasonable prices match the ambience. The restaurant was packed at lunch, but the service was friendly and fast.   I chose the green chili burrito and the butter tortilla. I'm trying not to eat carbohydrates, but how can one refrain when you are at the best tortilla factory in Phoenix? I enjoyed the green chili chicken filling in the burrito, but I do wish I had covered it in a salsa, sauce or cheese.   This place is the real thing, and a fun adventure.

tzCBD-ZIcpu1vUyAMyh64w.text: Hands down the best tortillas in Phoenix!!  The building and area look sketchy, but you can see into the clean kitchen and the food is amazing!!   Definitely a hometown pick for fast Mexican food in the downtown area... Hole in the wall, but well worth it!!

WC9JVnL34HGNEQgV-tiQMQ.text: Carolina's was the first stop we made in Phoenix. After a 6 hour long drive, we were in the mood for some Mexican so Carolina's seemed like a good idea. After getting off the freeway, I was a little confused on where this little Mexican joint was located. We were passing by random houses in a questionable neighborhood before we finally found it. Now, if this place isn't a dive, I don't know what is. The building reminded me of the old, rundown ones in LA, except this place was in the middle of desert.   We walked in and got some weird stare downs from locals. I guess we stuck out like a sore thumb in this neck of the woods. The restaurant reminds me of an old-school cafeteria. The tables/booths were are like ones from the 70's. You might know what I'm talking about, some old donut shops still have them. Our plan was to just eat a little bit because we had dinner plans a little later that night. We decided to get 2 tacos and an enchilada with a side of chips. Although Mexican isn't anywhere close to my favorite type of food, I thought the food here was lacking compared to all its' rave reviews. Even my boyfriend who loves Mexican food thought it was just alright. Unfortunately we didn't get to try their tortillas that they're famous for.   I don't know if Carolina's can beat the Mexican in SD. That's a tough call, but I can see how Carolina's would be a good spot if you're just in the mood for Mexican or maybe if it's late and you're piss drunk.

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States. #1: Enchilada and Taco

zdFqql2LLjXyxm0lqp6AjA.text: Always good, hot and fresh. Never old and never too old to go eat at. The place is still run down but the food compensates for the surroundings. Prices are still cheap compared to other Mexican restaurants.

6SohQek2ro-w6RSeu_qKZg.text: Hopped off the plane craving a taste sensation and this hit the spot. All the members of my party loved their food from tacos to platters we loved it.

WF2zULuKx_BlOAjZd3NRmA.text: Ordered a chicken chimi, hard taco, enchilada, tamale, rice, beans and tortillas. All was good except the enchilada was no Bueno, didn't like the sauce and cheese wasn't melted. Gross dining area but would be back for the food.

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Number 16. Chicken chimichanga.

6ulBM1QyoOMpe-iR5xhb5Q.text: This place is a must find and try! Its kinda a hole in the wall place that will make you question its' goodness, but get out of your car and order something! (before the line triples in length) I came here with a large party, so we did find it kind of hard to sit together, but still we enjoyed our meal. I tried the tacos and tamales, both delicious and leaves me wanting to try more.

IV4OKZ4jhpLSPpqsTLWR4A.text: This is as much an 'experience' as it is a delicious meal. The place has (I suspect deliberately maintained) the classic 'dive' look. With some of the best Mexican food ever.  The young man who took our order was very patient and helpful! We tried to order a little bit of everything so everyone could sample. (and yes...the tortillas are crazy-good!) Not a single food item was less than delicious...a couple were MORE delicious in our opinion. The shredded beef is amazing...so anything with that.  In particular DO NOT MISS the red and/or green chile burros! Everyone's favorites out of all we sampled. If you are a tamale and enchilada lover...then don't skip those either. The soft chicken taco was wonderful as well.  The salsa is thin but tasty...and the heat sneaks up on you after several bites...so don't immediately dismiss its impact! If you are feeling especially adventurous, try the two Agua Frescas flavors at the soda fountain! (Yummy and unlike any soda flavors in the USA) Between the crowds and the intense desert heat, I think this place really struggles with keeping cool...so either go before the hottest part of the day, or during a lull in the crowd to minimize your 'sweat factor'!

OQG27aqKiF3m4eQShr5UEg.text: Truly as good as it gets.  Fast (even when extremely busy), cheap, and delicious. It looks like an absolute DIVE, but damn it if it's not some of the best mexican food in the state.

E5_Kd1vpd0age6vrkY9mTQ.text: Chorizo and bean burro and the butter tortillas are a must have! The tortillas here are sooo good :)

oR42hsi2lAgdTyVNeNxMUQ.text: A friend said "if you evaluated this place by their chips and salsa, I would have left already".  Which was definitely True, the taco was great, the cheese enchilada was as alright. Another friend had the chicken enchilada and was raving about it. My biggest complaint was the lengthy wait to get out food.

LV-ce6xMl45ifdkQl71lQA.text: I'm so sad writing this review because I had such high expectations. I blame my husband for talking up the place so much.  Totally overrated. Don't get me wrong, I'll eat anything, anywhere if it's good, so the totally sketched out location, and dive-y no frills decor (decor is the wrong word, there is no decor) didn't bother me. But I have to say, I've had vastly better Mexican food. We got the machaca hard tacos and the machaca was so bland. The chicken soft tacos were ok. The cheese enchilada was awful. The killer for me was the tortillas used in our dishes weren't fresh. Also, they ran out of tortillas which I wanted to purchase and I was bummed about that.  My husband, who used to work in the area and frequented Carolinas says that this experience was a fluke, perhaps because we were there fairly close to closing time (although I don't think that's a valid excuse).  I wasn't impressed. Hubby wants me to return for breakfast with him and give this place another shot. Eh, I won't go out of my way to come back but if I'm in the area (unlikely) I guess I'd be willing to give it another try :/

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Exterior sign
Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dining area
Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cheese enchilada

qit5yQiqufBvrE1ko6uExg.text: Quick, cheap, and tasty burros (aka burritos)  I had a red machacha (shredded beef) burro to go. Which is machacha with red chile, beans, and cheese. I like the simplicity of the burrito and ate it entirely. The chile marinade is has a great taste so you don't need to add any salsa or anything else. Beef was tender. Be sure to use a plate as stewed juices comes out as you bite. And its wrapped in paper - could be cleaner with foil.  Cash only.

7Y55k96-d97Q00xwWnp9pg.text: This is absolutely one of the best places in the state. We all have our favorites but mine happens to be a red chili burro red enchilada style, a side of beans, and a Machaca taco. The tortillas are the best I've ever had.

l-QSLed03amDId0phhmAKQ.text: This place gets a lot of praise and I do agree that their tortillas are very good, but the food just doesn't do it for me when there are better options.

U6e_5Npa2WbpoqvPKD8pYg.text: Amazing food, love the red chili burro!! Plus I really do love the cheese enchiladas. They have great salsa and amazing tortillas, you really can't go wrong with this place.

xlU31t2AtaU3hjJ0g2AFqw.text: I am addicted to their breakfast burros (no little burritos here). Trying their in-house made Egg, Potato, & Chorizo with Cheese burro was a revelation and I look for excuses to buy breakfast at Carolina's as often as possible. Their hand-made daily tortillas are 16" of light, pliable, wheaty greatness. So Mexican that cheese & chicken are still advertised as new additions. No American ham, sausage, or bacon and you won't miss them at all. When I visit during breakfast or lunch the parking lot is filled with pickup trucks carrying construction workers to the tastiest & most affordable Mexican in the Valley.

2nNkFNRv-FREvp8_xJ9WQQ.text: Super low key, but authentic Mexican food. Good prices, fast, and always consistent. I'll make the drive to Carolinas anytime!!! Just a tip: take your food to go. Tends to get very hot in their cafeteria style dining area. Also, be prepared to swat a lot of flies!

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Doesn&#39;t look like much but trust it&#39;s the truth!!!!

lOFD1qHgh1oXkoU4iDdUQQ.text: The shredded beef tacos and bean burro were delicious, as always. The staff is super friendly.  The service has always been quick. Parking is not so great, but the food quality is well worth the effort.  I've been here several times before and I'll keep coming back.

a4AkkgOlfpPOdB6wxZJnwA.text: What it lacks in ambiance, and it lacks a lot at make up for in pure radio all yumminess!

agMQyMFNV8VdJpYUvrDo5Q.text: I wasn't impressed. Though not quite rude, the staff didn't seem very friendly. The food was decent - I ordered a chorizo burrito - but not good enough to return. The place was packed and it was somewhat challenging to find parking.

n0mlV45GlzPaZjTUfS72VA.text: Love this place I just heard about them and nothing but good things. Lines be outta the door this is my second time around and I'm gonna keep coming back! You guys are amazing keep up the good work.

-DYRP8iSUppx_5SDJjkviw.text: The reason I'm giving them a low score is because of the horrible phone service. Tried calling ahead - it rang for literally 3 minutes so he could put me on hold for 9 minutes and so I finally gave up and hung up. When I got here 1 person in line (ahead of me). Yes there were people waiting for their to go orders but I would think with the amount of time they've had of being a popular restaurant & being opened for business that they would have come up with a designated person or better phone order system. Not only that - the place needs a serious renovation. With the amount of money (multiple locations) I'm pretty sure they could afford to do a little at a time because it's seriously needed.  The food though, is pretty damn good. I'm not a big fan of their rice or beans. I usually come for the buttered tortilla, chorizo & egg burrito & my husband gets the machaca, egg & bean burrito.

X46JSRuAnsV8GI6Vcqr6lA.text: Ordered the shredded beef taco and bean burro. Both were delicious. Friendly staff and quick service before the rush came in.

QeG0MALItu6F4K4XFjd7fg.text: AMAZING! We were visiting from Miami and highly recommend this place. The smoked brisket and smoked pork tacos were different and AMAZING!  Highly recommend the rice bowls and margaritas as well. Great ambiance and great service! Patrick our server was extremely attentive and helpful! Looking forward to coming back.

7yYl3QIr7KGuSzQ9RanAaA.text: Best spot in south Phoenix.  Fresh food that always tastes amazing.  Yes parking is a pain and the building is old.  But the food is always amazing.

QLcCv6LR9QXVoNBM7cWJNA.text: Best no frills Mexican in town...close to work and just yummy food!  Don't expect a high class place or even date night quality...this is bare bones good inexpensive Mexican food!  The old school hot sauce is THE best!

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States

N8Dz_B_sOn5UfUyvM_GFlw.text: 3 stars for the food only.  As you see in most reviews service and cleanliness is sub par at best. Don't bother trying to change this through Yelp. Carolinas doesn't care!! I'm a Az native and have gone to here for years. Only reason to go is the food as the service and housekeeping has been bad since they opened. I have seen the help change several times over the years but you get the same crappy service. With a little direction and competent management they could put the US treasury out of business because they would be printing money!!so visit them with a empty stomach a lot of patience and tolerance and you should have a mediocre experience. Good luck. If you want a sit down dinner with food just as good if not better go to Comedor Guadalajara on Central and the 17. Check it out.

431145YAWHq8IjScOKJwQg.text: I love this place..This is our go to spot when we touch down...I get everything enchilada sauce. They cook with lard. I took a star off for the wait and my cousin had a bad experience with customer service. The food should be a little kid friendly and staff should be more friendly with giving options.  They should have it together by now.

SdgLn6zHDo7gjKGS1Wnawg.text: Went here for lunch last week. We left the office at 11:15 and got there around 11:30 and it wasn't that busy with all the crazy lines yet. But the dining area was jam packed. Once we ordered though there was a huge line that was forming.  I order a beef tamale and a machaca hard taco for under 5 dollars.  Even though they say soft only for the machaca taco, they will do a hard taco for you. I ate the taco at work and I brought home my tamale and decided to give it to my husband and he ate it seriously in 2 mins. What a fatty!  Yes, the place is a hole in the wall.  The place may look shady. However, I must say I would make the trip down here any day of the week so I can eat their food. I used to eat here 2 times a week when I worked down the street. Tip: When you want to go during lunch, make sure to call ahead and place an order because you might be waiting for a while or if you go after 1:30 it calms down more so you can find a seat and enjoy your food.  These are the only 2 things that I have gotten when I go here. Next time I will branch out and get something else to try it out.

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Machaca hard taco

fLbzppVeMB_iDSf5aZ4qvA.text: The best Mexican cuisine ever. I love Carolina!!!! Tortilla with butter. Cheese enchilada. Oaxaca burrito. Freeze take home tortillas. It is all good.

6dDvkBGd1BSWo3m89h2bQg.text: I love the food here my family and i take the 30 minute drive out here just for their food the green chilli burritos are really really good

nmiUAg59VjQ3kpXuNfkP6w.text: I would venture here a lot when I was younger and worked downtown. The wait is very long, be warned. We ordered ahead of time via phone call--so I would tell others to take advantage of that if that if they are pressed for time.  The food is good, savory, and hearty. Also spicy. Which is the bizniz.

_92NzlsX2PwdbRMmpCXG9g.text: I read about this place in Nate Silver's Burrito Bracket and being an out-of-towner I penciled it in as a definite for a visit.  It's proximity to the airport made it an easy jaunt after landing.  The place is not much to look at, but I choose to believe that's because they are focused on a great product and not touching up the paint.  I had a hard time choosing, but I ultimately settled on the Oaxaca Special burrito.  It comes with beef chorizo, beans, potatoes, and cheese.  Generally I prefer a few more ingredients in my burrito, but they did a lot with a little.  I thought I would miss having rice or pico de gallo or hot sauce in my burrito, but I did not.  The ingredients were all quality and were liberally apportioned.  Even the tortilla was high quality.  I also give their salsa (located between the soda machines in a pump) high marks.  I'm glad I made it in.

Rh06lakFEKrO3nIokVDlpQ.text: Love Carolina's! But the new deco at the one on Tbird and cave creek just doesn't work. Maybe if they painted the cafeteria white menu wall the traditional Carolina red, it would feel like Carolina's again...

cdaPQ4h8aTs1ENwo04F3qw.text: Scary looking outside, good burritos inside. However, I will say I've been several times cause my husband enjoys and I just can't find anything I like.

f0zLu4U7cQ5Zj9_ns1UOdA.text: One of these most authentic Mexican places I have been to in the states. Don't be fooled by the sketchy "warehouse" look of the restaurant, you don't want to miss this one. The staff was very helpful at the counter. The seating however is very limited. We had veggie Chimichangas and tostadas. It was topped with a healthy scoop of guacamole and sour cream. The shredded cheese tastes delicious. If you are in Phoenix, you wouldn't wanna miss this place. Will definitely go back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Bg086cB6Rj2SDOUMxwk45A.text: This is one of he best Mexican food that I've ever had. Its obvious that others think that as well since it always seems to be pretty busy. The portions are huge and the prices are reasonable. It's an eat-in or take out place. It has several tables and booths, but its a relatively small place. That being said, the times that we have gone there, we've always been able to find a spot to eat. The only reason that I gave it a 4 stars is because the outside and inside isn't the best to look at. It could use an upgrade, but then again, maybe that's what appealing about this place. I would rather have a "hole-in-the-wall" place with tasty and delicious food rather than a fancy chain restaurant that is appealing look-wise but mediocre food. I hope this place continues to prosper because it deserves it.

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States

cG0qMmDsXbSkJRKQ5ws5Dw.text: If you want to eat what Mexicans eat for Mexican food, this is it! I mean when you walk in there, it looks like where they filmed the first saw, but god damn are those tacos legit!

YW4RRa-3s7_isZ0voCVX4Q.text: The service was not good they served around 20 people before i had to go up and ask for my food which had been sitting there cold! Not good at all. Ritos is way better!

Dmby0ZF3SHPmBT75WQXg9Q.text: So, I have been doing well on my diet the past month or so, but it was about time for a cheat meal.  Tacos were definitely in order!   I had been to the other Carolina's locations before and have loved their food.  I decided to come down to the OG location today for lunch.  About that....I would highly recommend that you don't come here during lunch hours lol.  I got here around 11:40 and thought I would be able to beat the major lunch rush.  NOPE!  Walked inside and there was a line about 30 deep!  It took a little while to place my order.  Once I got up there, I went with 4 shredded beef tacos and an order of chips and salsa.  I had $12.00 in my wallet, and my total came out to $11.98!  Score!  Since this place was a madhouse, I decided to get my stuff to go.  I took it out to my car, threw up my sun shade and turned on the A/C and went to town.  Here is how they were........  Shredded Beef Tacos-  These things are fantastic!  Like I have said before, next to Tito's Tacos in Culver City, these are probably the best shredded beef tacos I have ever had!  They fry these tortillas crisp, then stuff them with well seasoned shredded beef, cool crisp lettuce, and a ton of shredded cheddar cheese.  Top them with their awesome red hot sauce, and you have damn near perfection!  I mowed these down pretty quick and honestly, could have ate about 2-3 more.  My first taste of carbs in a month was damn delicious!  Chips-  Their chips are great!  They are incredibly crunchy and always fresh.  They could probably use just a little more salt on them, but if you dip them in their amazing sauce, that makes up for the lack of salt.  Definitely pick up an order of these when you come.  They are fantastic!   I'm glad I made it down to the OG location.  I might not be heading back to this one (The Cactus Rd one is closer to home/work and tastes the same...excellent!) as often as I would like, but if I am near downtown and want some tacos, this is THE spot!

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Front of the building.
Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bag of chips.

Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lunch line on Friday 09/09/16 at around 11:40am (line was actually longer when I got there..this pic is after the line snaked around.)

5FmcUiL1Id4PbXvBXgAvfw.text: Sorry but when I walk into this place and I see an air intake that hasent been cleaned, EVER... Kinda makes me think of what we can't see. The food is great but come on... How can you sit there and honestly tell me you don't care how dirty this place is. Does that lint/dirt fly around our food back there. You stand there ordering this delicious food over 6 inches of crap on the air vents above you. I'm not the elite lol but I'm not gonna eat in crap. Then you have to wait 40 min for 4 tacos. What if your on lunch break ?!?! No one knows what's going on. There number system is a joke. They use the speaker when they want. But I guess the food is good

YjGUfDohJvmd7m7TmtQ7Rg.text: Casual doesn't begin to describe this down-to-earth neighborhood place. Look past the unassuming building, though, and enter to a straight-up paradise of great food and great value.  The door last week reminded patrons to order their Christmas tamales soon...a good sign of popularity with their local diners.  Chirizo, tamales, potatoes, pork, cheese, rice, beans, tortillas -- their menu has all the hits. Casual environment and plenty of tables to sit at while you undo paper wrappers and Styrofoam containers to access the tastiness inside.

Wfr8wmyaXx1fzwFSDOF6rw.text: I just ate one of their egg and potato burritos.  It looks great, but after my first bite I quickly realized it was mashed potatoes, possibly powdered potatoes along with powdered eggs.  I won't even describe the texture because it's exactly what you're already thinking.  Don't waste your $4.00 for a powdered breakfast burrito.

Py-ubQB4tT-sHRUOFuJKLw.text: One word:  outstanding!  More words:  I just flew in  from NYC to visit family and found out dinner is happening in 4 hours.  But I'm famished and need good Mexican food NOW.  Did a quick check for possible places while at the airport and Carolina's was top of the list.   It also happens to be 5 mins from the airport.   Someone in line behind me said the chimichangas are amazing so that is what I had.  Chicken with guacamole.  The prices are good but the food is amazing!  The chicken was hot and juicy.  The tortilla shell was crispy and fresh.  The guacamole hit the spot and the red sauce super spicy and delish.  What a treat!!! So glad I found this place.  It may have taken 8 mins to get my food which is not long to wait for such a treat!   Will definitely come here again.  Well done Carolina's!

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States

A3N0ffuRzYJzgSmP9YWyGw.text: I promise ya'll, I tried to get photos but, while I was getting the drinks for the wife and I, she dove head first into all the gloriousness that was our food!  I have a rule of thumb when it comes to ordering Mexican food: order a bean burrito upfront, if they manage to f@(k up a basic bean burrito don't bother ordering anything else and never come back.  Undoubtedly THEE best bean burrito I have had EVER!!! That said, I ordered the 3way, PSA-this is not some freaky style sex act so don't get your hopes up pervs, it is a combo burrito of red chile, green chili, and beans.
