I'd give them more stars if they were a little more efficient during the lunch rush and had cleaner or remodeled facilities I.e. Restrooms. You can get out of here for around $5 and still be full as can be. Great spot, would recommend.

zca7ftJZdyGDfSa6W8cTWg.text: Wow- another Phoenix area Mexican food disappointment. Went here on my way back from the airport. I was told I had to try this place near the airport- "looks  like a dive, but the food is awesome." Nope- the food tastes like how the place looks.  I ordered a chicken "burro" dinner- which is a burrito in this part of Phoenix I guess. It had boiled, "runny" chicken and some salsa in it. The chicken water was running down my hands as I tried to eat it and all over the table. The beans and rice were good- but not the best. The chips were okay- again not the best- and served in a bag with a tie around the top, like buying some chips form the grocery store. (I prefer warm chips) The red hot sauce was very good, though. The staff was pleasant.   I think this place has more of a cult following than food that is good. I wouldn't recommend it to anyone. I went to a similar concept restaurant in Mesa- Backyard Tacos- and it was in different league than this place.  Oh- the place is worse than a dive. (physical building)  I don't know why the city doesn't condemn the inside of this place. I've been to many dives- but this was a sub-dive. Please someone tell me a good Mexican restaurant in Phoenix. 2 years and still haven't found one....

yIMCSjY-q2xMVTRcsL_6gw.text: Came here straight from the Phoenix airport as a recommendation from our car rental staff member! He told us that this is the most legit Mexican food we would get in Phoenix, and boy was he right. This hole in the wall restaurant provided an amazing and authentic Mexican meal that have ever tried (and we have been to Mexico before!). It's absolutely delicious and extremely cheap.

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Taco
Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Enchilada meal

kLQHrV23CVNpDbUeFDBa0A.text: Great authentic tasting mexican food! The only problem i had was the lack of meat in my green chile burrito. Other than that the flavor was all there.

JWx2a5aPACLMXUlN7Pf3WA.text: Carolina's is an icon in the Phoenix Mexican food scene. Otherwise, they would be hurt by their terrible location, old worn out building, and lack of accommodations for groups larger than 4. Having said that, the food obviously matters above all because there is a constant flow of people from all classes of life walking through their door.   I've tried the enchiladas, tacos, and tostada (all excellent). I even purchased a dozen flour tortillas to go and enjoyed a piece of Carolina's at home the next week.  Don't expect to sit down and be served but you can expect great food and a piece of Phoenix history. I recommend phoning in the order and picking up. I see a lot of people walking in and grabbing their phone order to go.

s2gen-tyaa5hjRNf1-xb1Q.text: The restaurant was founded in 1968 by namesake Carolina Valenzuela, who still presides over the kitchen.   It was first at 105 W. Hilton Ave. and later at 1519 E. Mohave St.   Since 1986, it has been at 1202 E. Mohave in a building that also has housed a coin-operated laundry and a grocery store.        No one is bothered by Carolina's vague pricing.   People just order what they want with the understanding that their tab, including a large, refillable drink, likely won't exceed $5.        The tortillas, which are available by the dozen for takeout, are churned out by a crew of workers who stand before a bank of hot griddles, deftly flipping the paper thin rounds of dough and piling them up for packaging.      I am particularly partial to the soft-shell machaca taco.   It's a simple affair with a warm corn tortilla wrapped around a generous portion of the subtly spiced shredded beef filling.   It's a perfect starter before tackling the main course --- one of Carolina's incredible burros wrapped in a homemade flour tortilla.    The plain bean burro is majestic; the green chile burro, marvelous; the red chile burro, legendary; but the Oaxaca special with beans, chorizo, potatoes and cheese is pure heaven.    The rich, piquant flavor of the chorizo is enhanced by the cheese and potatoes and tempered by the beans and the chewy tortilla wrap.    Carolina's burros can be ordered enchilada-style with red or green sauce, lettuce and cheese, or deep-fried like a chimichanga.     Reprinted from an Az. Business Gazette article:May 1, 1997,

Tn4EOKn85fp37mFK7cTN0A.text: The best machaca burrito I have EVER had.  This place is a dive amongst dives.  No expense was spared decorating the interior... literally, no expense.  But the food?  Divine.  When I'm in Phoenix, no matter the purpose or the duration, I swing by Carolina's for a quick bite and a quart of machaca or red chili to-go (about $21).  I've sampled several things over the years and now make a b-line for just one thing:  I order the mixed machaca burritos ($3.50).  That "mixed" refers to the shredded beef AND a scoop of homemade refried beans, all wrapped into an incredibly tender/fresh tortilla (which they also make that day, ON-premises) along with a good dose of cheese.  Together, these three simple ingredients -- the cheese, beans and slow-cooked machaca -- create a flavor symphony that my palate would turn it's nose up to if approached by the fanciest French restaurant with a free dinner offer.  I get two of these and plop my butt down on the dirty plastic booths, close my eyes and (try) to savor each bite as slowly as possible.  Sadly, I'm always done in about 5 minutes.  I have eaten these on the road as well, but they are messy!  The bottom will almost always begin to leak juices from the shredded beef before you can even get halfway done.  If you dare to eat/drive, be sure to have some kind of tray (not a napkin or their thin paper plate, but a TRAY) on your lap... and wipes for afterwards!  With a location that is barely 1 mile or 1 minute off of the freeway, on the southern edge/entry to Phoenix, it is a mandatory stop for me when I'm in Phx.  There is a large parking lot that surrounds two sides of Carolina's and the interior is swamp-cooled (so it'll be muggy-hot during the summer months).  Drinks are fountain/self-serve style and utensils are all plastic/self-serve as well.  Note, there is a single bathroom, but it is very cramped (just a bit larger than an airplane) and it is less attractive than a Chevron's (I probably wouldn't even let my labrador use it... but I still love this place!!)  Oh and one more note, this diner gets very, very packed during lunchtime (11:30a - 1:30p) with suits, blue-collars, cops, everybody!  Even during the afternoon there is a constant, albeit shorter stream of patrons.  But do NOT hang out in this neighborhood after dark... let's simply say, it is a very, very tough part of town.

h4eaDx5FeRqRj5UGvdxA7Q.text: Best Mexican food in the valley hands down!!  Their enchiladas are just perfect! As spicy (my mouth's watering now!) as they should be. I find that a lot of Mexican restaurants tone it down when it comes to the level of spiciness they add to their food, to match some American taste buds, I guess but not Carolina's! I've been living in the valley for 8 years now (moved from California) and this is the best Mexican food in the Phoenix metropolitan area.   Their tortillas... HUGE. And I mean it... HUGE, biggest tortillas I've ever seen. They look like XL pizzas! And don't you think they're big only. They're big and flavorful. Reason why they've won awards before.  Now, say it with me: TA-MA-LES. You've never had a better one than the ones they make at Carolina's. Seriously. A-M-A-Z-I-N-G!  I could eat there every day for the rest of my life.

zrKzwDZ_7Lt9OkvGG2uRdw.text: I have been coming to "Carolina's" for years before it was Cool a Great Family Business the food is Fantastic, Reasonable, and Fast. The Quality and Taste has remained the same you can't beat "Carolina's" Old School Phoenix Flavor and decor you feel at home

MeaOlmgkfcGEbMFnxGM4nQ.text: If you've never had tortillas from this place your not living!!! Worth the wait!! Advice is to call in orders ahead of going during lunch as this place is always the go to!! The food is very good and when paired with the tortillas they are known for it's a must!! At times I will stop in and grab a tortilla with butter for a quick snack! Yes it's on the menu!!!

fsA1gFt_6S8egAAj4P64Xw.text: Went on my lunch break on a Friday which might have not been good as it was really packed. I had called in the order but there was still a long line to wait in. The food it's self was good and at a reasonable price which was a plus. The place it's self is small so not very much space to dine in.

SXdQhF_K6U_5CZObASMSpg.text: You would never know it from the look of this place, but the food is excellent. Most likely the best tamales I have ever had can be found at this off the beaten path dive. The neighborhood looks a bit sketchy and parking is terrible but it is worth it. The portions are very generous. I promise you will leave full and satisfied.

49H3MRGmGMFyRpHXRLfOpQ.text: OK Mexican food. Had the #13 Taco, Beef Enchilada and Tostada. Was excited since there was a long line. Had a hole in the wall atmosphere -bad formica booths with heavy ware signs, no decor -painted cinder block with big common room. Run to Tia Rosa-but that's 20 min away.

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States

-K8dPCZT5sFz0uK1qLyK2w.text: Don't fear a line that reaches to the back of the restaurant,  it will move fast! I usually go to the north location,  so this ones seems a bit more unkept bit that's ok...just older I bet. Tried the red machaca burro and added sour cream...delicious! The horchata didn't speak to me here,  though. It was bland,  so I'll have to try again next time.

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Love this place...usually go to the north location though!

r78tZAtLHmObC_GsdGiS3A.text: You want real Arizona Mexican food?  Not modern crap smothered in cilantro and onion?  Then you have to try the old stand-by in South Phoenix.    i highly recommend anything with machaca in it, but my favorite is the machaca mix burro, with shredded beef, beans, and cheese  Carolina's Mexican Food and Mi Patio are my two standards for when out of town or overseas guests want "real Mexican food"

OiiP9D6ronIxwwwYzrvGXA.text: The burritos here are good. I suggest the machaca burritos. They are super busy during the mornings and lunch time. It takes a while for your food to be done. Sometimes they do not answer your phone call to take orders when they're really busy. The place looks like a run down restaurant but the food is great!

qLOUc4sHZhBTbEtfzOIewA.text: Wow. If you're looking for some basic, delicious Mexican eats this is the place to be. Went for lunch and the line was crazy (for a reason). They have a walk-up ordering system where you order and pay and then wait for your order to be called. There's somewhat limited seating inside (only because this place is crazy popular) but people cycle in and out pretty quickly too. The air conditioning was struggling on the 110' day I showed up but the heat was soon forgotten as i was eating the food.   I opted for the chicken chimichanga which was phenomenal. There's very little flair about the dishes, they're quite basic but TASTY. The chimichanga was a little crispy pocket of fluffy tasty chicken heaven.   I'll be back to this place next time I'm in town.

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken Chimichanga
Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken Chimichanga
Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken Chimichanga

zdqjfAMUOL7sj3P_FCFeyg.text: Okay, 5 s for the food, 3 s for the service.  Food is delicious, savory and tastes a lot like my mom used to make. Homemade tortillas and beans, yum!  But DAMN GINA! 30 minutes to an hour wait for a green chili burrito? Heck no! Always busy, the building is run down and for the amount of business they get I'm pretty sure they could afford fixing it up. Anyways, go when it's not busy (not sure when that is) for decent service.

7s9Qdjs2m55sSK8Pasyaow.text: This place was great! I am not going to lie, when I pulled out of the airport and pulled into this place, i had some questions. As you could see, its not the most well maintained building/interior as far as restaurants are concerned.  Still, I just wanted good Mexican food, so i ventured in. The food was spot on. I am not sure what authentic Mexican food is because I've never been to Mexico...but it felt like if Taco Bell was to ever become an authentic Mexican fast food chain, it would be Carolina's. Not in a disrespectful way, but the food came out fast, really cheap for what you get, the flavors were amazing, and you had to grab your own drink.  I would definitely come here again.

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Simple, yet amazing

GYo2VrQUXVVV-9ubf6YQig.text: Carolina's has been here for what it seems like forever. I've been here several times over the years and while it's not the most fancy place around the food is out of this world. It always tastes homemade and the service is always friendly. Easily some of the best burrito as you'll ever have and I think the tacos are hands down the best in town. I like supporting local businesses and this is definitely one business I enjoy supporting 1 bite at a time

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States

u7vjI5UQguib2UWkEYd9Cw.text: Meximericana at its greatest. If you come here for lunch you will literally see every walk of life come through the door... especially because you'll be waiting quite awhile during its busiest hours.   Is it the best legit Mexican food in town? No. But it is pretty good, depending on what you order.  Their tortillas are on point.

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu
Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ZULY6y-5AkKEpAF6ui5HPQ.text: Hands down, the best Tamales ever!!!!  I travel all over the west for work and I have found none better.  Red sauce green sauce, it doesn't matter.  I've actually scheduled flights to have a layover in Phoenix so I could Uber to Carolina's to get some tamales.  I've had the for breakfast, lunch and dinner - not in the same day - that would be crazy.   The place doesn't look like much, and is very bare bones inside, but don't let that dissuade you.  It is minutes from the SkyHarbour airport rental car center.  You'll find all kinds of people dining there.   The menu is big, you order at the counter.   I've tried other things, tacos, enchiladas and flautist are good, chips are homemade, salsa (aka hot sauce) is too - its a little different tasting, but good. But the Tamales......amazing.  Red Beef are my favorite.

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Carolina

QK1uIg912q9eYLKP7A0oBA.text: I have been to two Carolina's locations and while this location is a little rundown and dirty, the quality of the food is delicious. Carolina's makes my favorite Red Beef Tamales in the area and is what I almost always get. The times I've tried other items, I've enjoyed those too and honestly need to try more of their menu items.

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tamales Red Beef

bVn5NMyxV3Iul5joM3YGGQ.text: Came here on my lunch break. I saw 2 other Mexican food restaurants on the way and I nearly went to one closer, Sooooo glad I went on to Carolina's. First of all I grew up in the Los Angeles area and I have had some amazing Mexican food. The food here was so good, it's at the top of my favorites list. I can't wait to go for lunch again. In fact I am planning a trip with my family because I was impressed.  If you are looking for some delicious real food, this is it!!!

crEB25ZgP8P0O0Fl-FPEsA.text: Amazing breakfast burritos! Easy menu, quick service, and friendly staff! My new breakfast burrito spot!

nAwxSJzE-obpeTbZ3c9-WA.text: Ok, first off I'm giving this place 5 stars because I've been coming here since 1980 when Mohave  was  THEE area I spent most of my teen years.   You will not find a better place for Mexican fast food in midtown; no matter that it's looks as if it's never been remodeled since it was established.   This is the spot I hit up for the best tasting chorizo with potato and eggs burrito, the smoothest, tastiest tortillas, the tamales (try the #11 combo) and the machaca.   Service is slow everyday, calling ahead can be frustrating because you're always placed on hold for MINUTES.  But hey, it's worth it all after a few bites of that chorizo burrito.   This is the only place we buy fresh tortillas for our parties and during Christmas and New Years we order tamales, although the tamales have become woefully smaller through the years.   I promise, once you get a taste of this food, you'll return again and again. Enjoy yourselves.

ezc-ZaWitNhmcfURKKAx2g.text: Best little hole in the wall Mexican restaurant... Awesome food and great customer service. It's has a dine in area. It's always busy but fast .

xCOzwQVouFdUcilp5dHEZQ.text: For the love of all things sacred and holy...FIND THIS magical oasis in the desert. But be forewarned...it is a religious experience. The tortillas...are made ultra fresh every day...no...wait...every hour...with a secret recipe that is guarded by a dragon and only seven artisans understand (ok-I made up the dragon part - but they're AMAZING).  And...did I mention the salsa? Sensational!  Or how about the ingredients (beans, potatoes, chorizo) they use in the burritos? Incredible!  And the chips? Chiptastic! In all seriousness...if you want/love/need authentic, fresh, home style Mexican food...go here. Immediatamente. Amen.

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States

uHr4sqZXWCK_PitxTo8AfQ.text: Well, this is the place. Off the beaten path, just south of CenPho, serving family recipes since 1968. The food is to die for, it's the real deal.   I remember my mother discovering this place more than 30 years ago, introducing me to green chili for the first time. A nearby project has allowed me to stop by often lately.  Today I tried the 3 way burro which is loaded with red, green chile, signature beans and melty cheese shred. The piquant first bite of either end will set the tone. The handmade tortilla is thinner than most, but you don't seem to mind as the flavors burst on your tongue. Today it was red chili first. After 2-3 bites you can expect the other end to start leaking, so watch out! The beans are whole and add character and substance to the most excellent combination of flavor and tortilla snap.    The whole thing took only a few minutes to wolf down, wishing you had slowed down to savor it a bit longer.   At $5.25 a dozen, the handmade tortillas to go are a bit pricey, but they are big burrito size and have the feel and texture of rural south of the border. Hmmm? What to load them up with when home? Half dozens for $3.25  There are mex choices for anyone who likes good home cooking. Breakfast in the morning, lunch and dinner available all day except Monday. There are Burros, specialties, tacos, tamales, enchiladas, combination plates and some light items for the discerning kiddies. There's something for everyone. At the end, you'll find yourself licking your fingers and chops for more.   This unique place is not easy on the eyes. It's rough hewn, comfortable enough, stark seating and practical. I imagine they do a half a million $ in takeaway a year. Authentic food takes leaps over the ambiance.   You'll never know who you will see here. All walks of life know good food by history, word of mouth, not to mention the family element through the years.   Not a miss on any mex foodie list!  I'm going back for more! 02/21-19 Went back 2 weeks ago and still agree with what I wrote!

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The no frills order, pick up and pay counter

kjaylO9R9KBoygoTAhm_0Q.text: This is absolutely a hole in the wall place but ohhhh is it delicious. They have fresh handmade tortillas daily. I specifically go for their breakfast burritos I love bean and cheese and the chorizo egg and potato burrito.  They also have Machaca. I am not a huge fan of their lunch/dinner menu but the tortillas on their own are enough for the five stars. They are heavenly!!

ZUm3e6kpZuZ3sAUGkpW_iA.text: You know this place is good because it's hidden in a neighborhood you'd never think a restaurant was in, in a building that is as old as the houses, but what really gives it away is the crowd of people trying to order their food, which makes it look kinda like a mosh pit. The food... ugh. I don't even know where to start without going into a food fantasy, where I am the queen and the chimichangas are my edible servants. *10mins later* anyway, the chimichangas are clearly my favorite, they're always so hot and fresh and stuffed with so much meat and flavor one could probably faint. The rice and beans, which is hard to get wrong but does happen, NEVER happens here, they're always delicious and tastes like actual beans. Another one of my favorite things about coming here, is their option to buy a pack of FRESHLY HANDMADE TORTILLAS!!! I buy a pack EVERY TIME and happily put myself in a cheese quesadilla comma for the next couple of days. I don't even mind the 5 extra pounds. Love this place. Always sad to leave but when you have no more room in your stomach and a life to get back to, what can you do? Haha.

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Nummmmmmyyy!

b4DfSH12ekljY7mGdLDEww.text: This is about the food.  Not the service, which isn't great and isn't bad. Not the ambiance, don't look around, and don't make eye contact. Not the decor, *shudder*. Not about YOUR Expectations. Its a tortilla factory in a sketchy part of town that sells food from a counter. its also very busy, because everyone else who knows the deal is there willing to suspend their "restaurant experience " for some awesome food.  This is about the Tortillas, the red chili, the Machaca, the beans, the chorizo and potatoes. Did I mention the Tortillas?  I grew up in Southeastern Arizona, and have a certain level of expectations about Mexican food, and about Tortillas in particular. When the wife and I were young,  dumb (me not the wife), newly married and moving down here to finish College at ASU, we tried all the "local" Mexican food places. I won't call them out by name, because it's not worth drawing their ire or making them feel bad. You don't talk badly about people you went on one date with and realized it was all their was ever going be five minutes into the date. You just move on.  Likewise after choking down  several different versions of bad "locally made" tortillas, i just realized i would have to be nice to the rural relations in hopes their visits would include tortillas.  THEN, i attended a work party, that the boss had graciously picked up 50 red chili mixed burros for. WHAAAT? where the heck did these come from? did someone make a trip to Globe or Tucson? Using every bit of my best Spanish inquisition impression, i found out where and when this great secret was located. Seeking the holy grail, i found it and make repeated pilgrimages since.  The best are the burros, although the other items are good also. Breakfast burritos, particularly the chorizo potato and eggs are heavenly, right amount of spice and portions.  Machaca is best in town. You heard me, the best. good flavor and portions. right balanced. tender  The secret menu item not a secret, is if you are going to just order tortillas to take home, and believe it or not it happens, get  a hot buttered tortilla for a snack. So Good! its the best part of your childhood revisited.  So, if you are jonesing for some real sonoran mexican food, especially for takeout, go do yourself a favor and go get some. And pick up a dozen tortillas to eat on later in the week.

cds2f39S9tD1gUKOZBCKfw.text: Karolina is a very very good family eatery you almost always have to eat at home or in your vehicle because there's not a lot of seating even though they did expand and they moved from 16th St. and Mojave we love them van and we love them today and that's been 40 years of us loving Carolinas Mexican food

hZUS8fu2fSrfqP4yhuzODg.text: This place has good food, but some of the people who work there clearly do not like white people. If you are white and decide to eat at this establishment, do so at your own risk!

ncCvE4dhVWgS4NhXlyFOuw.text: This place is a dump. Went there the other day for the first time in about 10 years.They have done nothing to improve the inside of the store. My hands were very dirty. The restroom had no soap. I asked an employee for soap and he gave me a nasty look. I let another employee know there was no soap in the restroom he also seemed to not care. It was also very hot inside. Swamp coopers were not getting the job done. All of the tables were dirty and cans were overflowing with trash. I decided to leave. Maybe the owners will put some money into the location that has made them millions. An air condition would be a good start. I am sure your customers and employees would really appreciate it. I will check back in 10 years. Hopefully they will have soap in the mens room.

8St2IGdiaoe19qULl2tgZQ.text: The food is delicious but the service is horrible the cashiers have a horrible attitude and on some days trying to place a phone order is maddening and I caught the kitchen staff talking crap about customers because they had no idea I spoke Spanish

J5rvk32YEqECJ4AMQWy5dw.text: Mmmm...!Delicioso!  This place is a local gem. The restaurant isn't known for the atmosphere, but for the good food! It's in the ghetto, but the food is cheap and delicious. I always get the tostada, but the butter tortillas are amazing too!!! I take my out-of-town friends here whenever they ask for authentic Mexican food.

KFMqVwsDJj8UR11i5be4rA.text: Great hole in the wall. Greasy, and you get served on styrofoam plates and eat on plastic chairs. But the food is delicious. And you can pick up a dozen tortillas to go on your way to the airport, which the folks back at home wlll appreciate.

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States

986nSj3x5e7EEvDi74UX7Q.text: Home made tortillas!!  Some of the best tortillas I've ever tasted and i grew up in the southwest.  price is cheap too.  i recommend ordering the Oaxaca (pronounced...Wahaka) burrito or the #13 combination plate.  The Oaxaca is filled with homemade chorizo, beans, potatoes and cheese.  The #13 plate comes with a beef enchilada, a beef taco, a bean tostada and beans and rice.  All for about $6.  Also, did I mention their tortillas are that good??  order the butter-tortillas for about 90 cents.  Place is located in the heart of the barrio, but around lunch time you'll find people from all walks of life in there.  firefighters, police officers, academic counselors, business men from corpo america, etc...

MynlN_F4bNERgPaLJ4wvJA.text: Leave it to my boyfriend and I to plan a vacation and have a trip to a Mexican restaurant be our first stop.  Yep, that's us!  We read about this place in a travel guide.  The description said that we might fear our surroundings.  They were right!  There are bars on the windows!  But oh well.  Because you know you are in a good Mexican restaurant when there are more Mexican-Americans in line than anything else and you can see them making the tortillas in the background.  Oh yum, you are in for something good.  Adding to the ambiance is that your order off a very large board where there are no descriptions, only names of foods written in Spanish.  And you won't recognize LOTS of the words.  But why order a burrito when there are 15 things you've never heard of up there.  Go for some adventure!  I did and wow was it a good choice.  Delicious tamales.  Awesome pork burritos.  The rice and beans are amazing.  And they have a nice variety of Mexican fountain drinks for the adventurous.  Stop #1 on vacation was a good one.  Go and don't worry about the neighborhood ... they will know why you have come!

YzdJ4DVRvOlG6JC8PwRxYg.text: This is one of my favorite burrito spots.  Cheap, good quality, tasty...what more can you ask for????  The tortilla's can make or break a tortilla....and they are definitely yummy.  My favorite here is the chorizo....  FWIW....it's not located in the best neighborhood.....

DJs4CrDqPtxbEnme_y3t0g.text: I love this place!!!! OK it's not a place you actually want to dine in at but the food is so f'n good, just order and leave. I have had most things on the menu (no menudo though) but my fave is the machaca burros and crunchy tacos with a half dozen of the 1oz salsa cups. And after filling up on this I snuggle up to a dozen of warm fresh giant tortilla's (still in the wrappings of course). I like to order a quart of the machaca for later consumption in burro's, over rice, with eggs, my list could go on.   You would think with the mounds of money they have to be making from the constant lines of people they would do some upgrades to the place. Oh well, keep the food great and we will keep coming.

2i4EUQ78pO-cvmDTj2kFEA.text: Had Carolina's for lunch yesterday.  Just happened to be downtown with some clients I am consulting for.  Got the beef enchilada combo.  The food was great as always.  I usually go for the burros, although I rarely get through a foot long (who could?).  My colleagues got cheese enchiladas and chicken tacos.  Everyone was very happy with the food, and we all left stuffed.  They even paid!  The only thing better then lunch at Carolina's is a free lunch at Carolina's.

QJC5kPYil3JSIGyO65YAlA.text: This place is a hole in the wall, so be brave when you go after dark. But, they have the softest tortillas that's all handmade and fresh daily.  I love their Chorizo, Green Chilli, Salsa, and refried beans. Though it's still affordable, their price has been hiked a couple times since last year. Also, make sure you call in for pick up at lunch time if you don't want to wait in long line for your food~!!

G-kfkgXAze1UnLT7iU8p_Q.text: Looks suspect however had good reviews so we are checking it out... Food was subpar there is a reason why the food is cheap....

WwwbDQJo08F-nIJq71yXtA.text: Carolina's is a True staple of Mexican Food tradition in Phoenix.  They're food is authentic, delicious and well-priced....Absolutely LOVE the tamales and homemade tortillas!  For "throwdown," great Mexican Food; Carolina's is an absolute!

5SOzBoOxNFvhfZ5XAjxUag.text: Skip it!   I don't care about the neighborhood (more industrial than ghetto) and was willing to eat in a dining room that was not maintained, by the looks of it, more than once daily. None of this matters when good Mexican food is to be had. But nothing in the #6 or #8 combo was above average. The edible items were the rice (average), beans (below average), and the chorizo/potato combo which was better together than the sum of its parts as the chorizo itself was below par. The tortillas, despite their reputation, are average at best and only if you like the paper thin variety. The enchiladas were inedible as the sauce tasted worse than store-bought and there was no cheese to be found. In fact, I left most of it where I found it.    Being Hispanic from San Jose and having eaten homemade Mexican from both my grandmother and during a two-week trip at age 19 to the middle of Chihuahua where no one who served me food spoke English, this is neither authentic nor tasty. Hate to give Mexican food bad reviews anywhere but this place keeps popping up on ten-best lists where it should be on a ten most overrated list. As a first timer who visits from California if I had to try something else from the menu I would go with the breakfast burros, but doubt I will ever go out of my way to give it a second chance.

PuNnx8D_WVhc1iljDRGRwA.text: Best tortillas in the state hands down. The usual for me is a bean n cheese burrito double wrapped. There salsa is also unique and delicious. Wouldn't mind if this place was opened later....

Yu_hLtWAzp2wnNglAc5xlA.text: I'm a fan of this place, always crowded for the lunch crowd but your number gets called pretty quicky. I'm going with the three beef enchiladas today.  The tortillas here are amazing!

D2EzUIZfJDS9PQIQIQ9Egg.text: Great Mexican food. Really yum as my husband says. There are almost none choices for vegetarian.

02cuYK9vZcUQN8_z4ZL3Vw.text: it took me awhile to actually find this place.  but it was well worth the wasted gas.  the burritos, tacos, beans, rice are all good.  the food is top notch.  if you go during lunch on a work week be prepared to wait in line to order and fight for an available table.  the food is worth the fight.

Rb3u2nC3z_RtNfzYjjTc3w.text: Upon arrival at Carolina's Mexican Food, one might be a little distrusting of the location. Although they're placed in a sketchy neighborhood in downtown phoenix, Carolina's food is far from bad. Their building is painted white with red lettering that informs newcomers about their famous tortillas. On the inside there are AC ducts completely visible on the ceiling, next to their multitude of ceiling fans. The cement floor and old walls are equally run down.  Although this may seem very displeasing, the food definitely makes up for the lacking interior design.      The food at Carolina's is best described as delicious, authentic Mexican cuisine. They are best known for their large and thin flour tortillas, for which they have won multiple awards. The chicken and machaca (beef) is delicious in any of the dishes they have. My personal favorite was the chicken mix burrito (which includes beans and cheese) and chicken quesadilla. The chicken burrito is filled with delicious refried beans and gooey cheese, along with juicy chunks of chicken, all wrapped up in their glorious tortillas. The chicken quesadilla was very large, with some dry spots of no cheese near the edges of the tortilla, but the center was packed full of savory pieces of chicken and cheese. Their salsa that is made on the spot is also incomparable to any other salsas I've ever tasted. All in all, everything I ordered was delicious and authentic tasting.      So in short, Carolina's Mexican Food is a 4 out of 5. The only reason that it isn't a 5 out of 5 is because of the location it's in and the condition of the interior. If you don't mind going to a worn down restaurant and you're looking for some great food, Carolina's is the place to be. It is now the standard by which I rate all Mexican food, making many other "Mexican" restaurants taste like McDonald's. Also it would be valuable to note that although it may seem like a bad portion of town, police are a common sight in the restaurant and so is anyone else that knows where to get an amazing burrito! I will definitely be coming back to Carolina's in the future.

Y9qWc73twuTCRBO2xapq7A.text: Now I know why they call this place a hole in the wall....it literally has a HOLE in the WALL.  Exposed drywall, sweat dripping off the AC unit onto your face while you wait in line to order -- exactly what you'd expect from the best burrito stop in town.  Order a dozen tortillas to go...you won't be disappointed -- they melt in your mouth!

zph7LZlTPzURi5O_y3Qwvw.text: Great burritos. Combo plates are also good. Great for breakfast, lunch and dinner. You have to watchout during lunch hours, small parking lot, small building equals big headaches..

IRs7n8Qh8HBrm_RxhbDTNg.text: Rolled in here for Lizunch today and the food was okizay, got the Bean Burro enchilada stizyle and must say the Tortilla was the best pizart, but I've had better Mexican food in Scottsdizale.

zOT5q-4yhqyUvWwNvpUuSQ.text: Been going to carolina's since I was a kid always love there machaca burritos  are soo GOOD and the tortillas are the BEST I have taste it in my whole entire life !!!

8ZXCL3onOBy1xUJ3fYB36A.text: C'Mon...  It's Carolina's!  I does not get any better than this if you want red chili burros.

C_C04thZGuC87Hu9I2FHZw.text: After experiencing the wonder that is Carolina's West, I decided to check out the original location.   To say the place is rough looking would be a major understatement. It is an old building in a marginal area. The floor in the place looks very garage-like, only with water and spilled soda puddling on the floor instead of motor oil. It all adds to the overall charm of the place.   The food, of course, is top notch. As good or better than their West Valley location. Service is quick, and sometimes even friendly, though not uniformly. It was an experience I hope to repeat soon. Just great, basic, Mexican food.

-1NTq1U1a1_muM76a0_9Uw.text: I enjoyed they're machaca plate. The rice reminded me of my mum's church and my mum's refried beans. mmmmmm

XtBk08lUVyA--dPC4tQfFQ.text: Aw Aw Aw AWESOME (sorry for the stutter...but it was hard for me to express how much I love Carolina's.)   Growing up in a border town, I love my Mexican food.  This also makes me ultra critical of Mexican restaurants.....but I have nothing critical to say (which is strange coming from someone who has the tag line "always the critic.")  The food is super authentic.  The price is great.  The facility is a total DIVE which makes me love it that much more.  The kitchen is wide open so you can watch the ARMY of staff making tortillas, prepping the food, and packing it for your tasty delight.    You gotta try this place!  PS - pick up a pack of piping hot tortillas to take home.  They are the size of a manhole cover.

a5BhcXmPWsxHQjq91E2udA.text: The best beef tacos in the valley!!! I also love the salsa because it has the right amount of heat. The homemade tortillas are excellent and I always get an order to go. I would give it five stars but the building is a dump. Still love Carolina's though!!!

FY8og98qsyKNXEShI-2_HQ.text: Took the drive out to Phoenix hoping I'd finally find some great Mexican food. Unfortunately I was disappointed. I ordered a chorizo, egg, potato & bean Burrito. I gave that a 6/10. What killed it for me was the cleanliness of the restaurant. Dirty tables, salsa spilled on the floor & tables. Plus they said they had horchata...it was one of those OLE fountain drinks. I was shocked. Seriously if you can't make your own agua frescas, I can't trust you to make me Mexican food. I lived in California for 24years, 15min away from Mexicali, Mexico. I know Mexican food & this ain't it for me.

M_dmpR6MLfHIe74pqSqTFA.text: I almost feel peer pressure to give it another star, but it IS just A-OK for me.  Been here a few times, trying to love it more... The tortillas are awesome, and buy as many as you're going to eat w/in a few days... the tortillas aren't full of crap and won't stay soft forever.  But for the rest, it's good or ok.  The Oaxaca burro consist of soft boiled potatoes (was scared it was the home fried kind) and really enjoyed it.  Meh on the enchiladas and the red chili beef's flavors were too muddied... not the bright chili flavor I get elsewhere.  I'd come here whenever I'm looking for Mex in CenPho, but I wouldn't make a point to drive out to it.

FZSDSMWzOzx-hpyE1JONbA.text: Carolina's is absolutely amazing! My rating is definitely based off the quality and authenticity of the food. Yeah the downtown location is not the most inviting atmosphere, but really that's part of its charm. There are people from all walks of life in there, sharing in a common love of authentic Mexican food. This may not be the best spot for a first date, but a great place to go over and over again.   During peak hours it gets really busy (both lunch and dinner ). If you are in a hurry, call ahead to order.

ooArGfH_KG-aJDfgbBg6Sg.text: Try the number 9, the most amazing tacos  ever.  And the chips and salsa are out of this world.

L8a5eVbCr5OUEr6DV81g8g.text: Those of us that work in the downtown Phoenix area usually stick to places that are within walking distance when going out for lunch (we don't want to loose are good parking spot, right?!). However, a couple times a year, some lovely soul will decide to make a run to Carolina's and offer to get lunch, or breakfast, for a few people.   This is where you can tell if you are in the cool crowd at work. We all know what it is like when you have to order and pick up food for 20 people = NOT FUN! If you get invited to join the "let's order from Carolina's" group, you know your haven't made anyone mad that day!   I've only had the burritos and tacos but both have been delicious! The breakfast burritos are great.  If you let the tacos sit too long, they will get a little soggy/greasy, but in that really good way! =) Hot sauce is the perfect amount of spice, just about a medium I would say.   The best part is the tortillas (corn or flour) that you can buy by the half or full dozen an take home to enjoy with your own creations. Warning: The flour tortillas are HUGE, yet soooooo good!!!!   If someone at work mentions Carolina's, and I am lucky enough to be on the invite list, all previous lunch plans are in the trash and I am reaching for my Carolina's menu to scope out my selection!

VezbM55fQAhhm05077823w.text: My entire family, friends, and I have been coming here for a long time. I'm not sure where the best Mexican food in the valley is but I think this place is up there. The best beans, machaca, and tortillas I've had. This is also the location to go to as well. Looks a little run down but the food makes up for it.

5VNOn9-24CN7l3r-74eG7Q.text: When I moved to Arizona from Colorado I thought there was bound to be better Mexican food options than Colorado.  There were a handful of Mexican restaurants that really impressed and did not seem like the TexMex you come to expect.  Carolina's is the top of that handful of restaurants.  It gets packed quick at lunch time and often times you have to send someone to hover over tables while others in your party order food.  It makes for a weird atmosphere, but the food has always been good.  I no longer live in Arizona, but this and a few other restaurants are on my list to try and make sure I make it to when I travel back there.

Z07W-8aoeWYBMVnwiaHQWw.text: best home made Mexican food. Great Prices. Best handmade flour tortillas in Phoenix and may be in Arizona.

asoRNbuKVXXyAOpsX_0J5A.text: well as far as my foood it was amazing exp there homade tortillas...!! As  as the customer service some chick was actually quite rude and had absolutley horrible cusotmer service

_e91gIssfRrcB4eHPPBWUQ.text: Best burritos in town.  great salsa and the best homemade tortillas.  Check out this hidden jewel and don't let appearances deceive.  This is some of the best food in the valley.

rrEPjlixUCMCMY4pQQW8Vw.text: Just  like  LoLos did it with his established chicken n waffles when you  are  ready to  go  forward its is OK to branch out..  but keep your  core foundations where you  started...  Carolina stays True and  has done JUST THIS and hasn't   changed.. shes successful   and still the best..(in my best Mafioso esque scarface voice) BEST MEXICAN FOOD  IN THE SOUTH SIDE OF PHOENIX. Carolina  with the  Mojave  Location  captures "old school  in the hood "essence  with it's neat tucked away  but easy to locate  spot to chill...  I'd  come here  on break  with  my then boss when  i worked  with  the Sky Harbor Airport  in 2005 its been some years  but i still  have  the taste of  the  burrito  and carne  asada tacos  i had in my memory...

T3rbJOxMvWCxmaFPwLaF4Q.text: In the downtown area, I highly recommend making the stop.  Tends to be a bit busy at lunch, staff moves quickly to accommodate.  I ordered the Red Machaca with Beans.  Excellent flavor, subtle heat, perfectly cooked.  A hit!  One tip, if you order a side of chips and salsa, make sure you have friends dining with you or be prepared to bring home a Doritos sized bag of leftovers!

Y7fjLfQjcZlgNlZ8g2fr-g.text: Carolina's Mexican Food is both authentic and delicious!! Somewhat sketchy location, but if you carry out, the location doesn't make much of a difference. My favorites are the bean and cheese burrito and the green corn tamale (I'm a vegetarian, so I can't provide feedback on the meat, but I'm sure it's just as delicious). The tortilla's are handmade pieces of heaven, which you can purchase in bags for your own home-made delights.   Today, I put my order in around 11:30, and the place was practically empty. But within five minutes, it completely filled up, so get there early if you don't want to wait! It took about 15 minutes for my food to come up (2 bean and cheese burritos and a tamale) which wasn't bad. The people watching is interesting enough to keep you entertained until your food is ready. If you're looking for some cheap, tasty Mexican food, and you're in the downtown area, I would definitely recommend Carolina's.

4kQxQGKvEUBSYPmbD_PvNg.text: Food and salsa are great the service is always bad. I have been going here on and off for about 6 years and will be giving them another break in service for about a year. Not sure why you would call your order in a head of time and then wait for 3 breakfast burritos while watching people who just walked up to the counter receive their food. When I asked the young lady at the counter how they were getting their food before me when I called in 20 minutes prior she said it all depends who takes your order and who is making it... Well as I had an appointment to be at, that is why I called ahead and asked how long it would take, I told her to cancel my order to which she said "Okay!!" with a big smile. I sure hope their food quality never gets to low because their customer service won't save them. See them again in a year... well if they are still there.

YGP1k65rtoJWp-Zx11Z9xA.text: I love their tortillas and their salsa. Their salsa has a strong garlic flavor and is unlike any other mex joint I have encountered in AZ. Carolina's has a very extensive and cheap menu; two people can easily eat for under $10.   Watch out! Carolina's gets CRAZY during peak eatin' hours from its downtown cult following.

zju3PazeZkz3KKeDpZdmIw.text: I've been going to Carolinas since I was in nursing school, nearly 10 years ago. The prices have increased over the years, but the quality of food has never changed. It's the best Mexican food restaurant in the entire southwest! Keep it up! Everything is made from scratch. Just like grandmas cooking!

kJawcbHikHVwgo7AETwYIw.text: The tortillas are really good, made fresh daily. (try em with butter) The have like 100 employee's working every day. Place can get busy at times. It's in the hood of Phoenix. If you haven't tried, it's worth it.

B0w9bjlF707c0OoWOooISg.text: I searched many stores looking for tile that looked like wood. Bar none, SCS Tile  had the best prices and the best selection. What was impressive to me was the customer service I received from Khalid. We were in an incredibly tight bind. We needed our tile quickly and Khalid promised we'd have it. On the morning of the pick up, we learned the tile was delayed. I flew into a panic, but Khalid assured me it was on its way. He had the truck deliver the tile to the job site later in the afternoon much to the relief of our contractor from Square Foot Tile! I would highly recommend SCS to anyone who has a critical job and is looking for a fair price. Thank you Khalid!

arfL2JvAQcKUhI1MqXV3dg.text: This location is in the hood but I don't care. I will go anywhere for Carolina's tacos! I don't know what they do to the tacos here but they are like crack. I could eat them everyday! With rice and beans and a side of sour cream. I can't get myself to order anything else. This Mexican food joint lives up to the hype.

a5_WIbabrtBzy2x47Bv-og.text: Press and word of mouth are very find to Carolina's Mexican Food.  You'll read about in papers and magazines, you'll see it on television and people will tell you about it.  A place like this will amaze you or leave you feeling let down.  For me it was the latter.    It may not be fair of me to hold the hype factor against Carolina's but it's hard not too.  The food was not bad by any means but it was nothing special compared to Mexican joints elsewhere.  I ordered the beef enchilada and taco meal.  It was good but not great.  I've had better at other Phoenix eateries.  It's on the larger side for a divey Mexican joint but the eating area is drab and lives up to the grimy reputation of hole-in-the-wall restaurants.  This does not bother me in the least as I come for the food but this may be an issue for some.  If you're overly picky about cleanliness be sure to avoid the bathroom.    I won't go out of my way to return to Carolina's but if I find myself in the area again I will be more than happy to drop by, try something else off the menu and see if I can't be swayed to update my review.

OEkAtWjqsfaUAnAWRBivuQ.text: Excellent Burritos and tortillas.  I had a Chorizo/Egg/Potato/Bean and a Green Chile and they were both super-tasty.  $7.98 total.  The chorizo is different in a GOOD way than what I have had elsewhere in town.  The spices they use give it almost a "signature" taste.  A lot different than most I have had, possibly the tastiest.   It's easy to see why they sell the chorizo uncooked for people to take home - they know they have a winner on their hands.  The green chile is very good too, and very close to Rito's flavor, which I have always considered the best green chile burro in town.  Rito's burros are a little bigger than these though.  I'm going with a big-time thumbs up on Carolina's, a solid 4.5 stars.  Can't wait to go back.....:)  P.S.  UPDATE !!! After going for breakfast here about 10 out of the last 11 weekends, I still LOVE this place.  I normally now eat the Chorizo Tostada for breakfast, and get one of the burritos to take home - any flavor is good.  HOWEVER, I tried one item today that was sub-par and I'd like to warn people about.  The Hard Taco was not good AT ALL.  First, it was one of those taco shells which is not crunchy, and not soft, but kinda.....stretchy?  The meat was shredded beef, and it was greasy with no apparent seasonings.  Quite unexpected from a place where SO many things are GREAT.  Anyway, stay away from THAT one item, but everything else I have tried is great.  P.S. UPDATE NUMBER 2:   The best time to eat at Carolina's is on Saturday.  They have the "Menudo Fixins" put out for you to use:  Chopped cilantro, chopped green and white onions, oregano, and red pepper flakes, and lemon wedges.  You don't have to eat menudo to use these fixins, and I like to put them on my tostadas or burros and it really takes the flavors to another plateau.  A must-do.

aw-IJQSaoixqap4do3E3Qw.text: I've been here quite a few times, and I always order the Oaxaca Special.  Although it's a little greasy, it's absolutely delicious.  The burritos are big and the prices are pretty reasonable.    The only thing I don't like about this place is the location.  It's in a not so great part of town, and the building looks super old and rundown.  The other two Carolina's locations are considerably nicer.

wGYoNUagYtbg90M8POI-_w.text: Go here if you want old-school Mexican Food.  This place serves amazing tortillas; breakfast burritos and has pretty good authentic Mexican food.  I would give this place 5 stars, but the location is a little out of the way, which does give it some charm in the New Times sort of way.    During the winter in the mornings it can be a little cold, but the food warms you up and the wait is always worth it!

lMt9nBvNZkL5O4ZbYr_GZA.text: When I lived and worked in Phoenix, I had my first experience at Carolina's as a lunch trip with a coworker. She told me that they had the best tortillas and was fast enough to fit in our lunch break.  I cannot tell you how delicious all their food is...flautas, enchiladas, combo plates, tacos. chimis, etc. Even though I'm back in Chicago, I dream about this place. I recommend it to my friends when they head to Phoenix area, and I hope that when I visit next, I have time to drive out for lunch.  The sauces are delicious and everything is homemade. They take pride in their food and are quick with the service. Delicioso!

Fykq2VkC2EfWTvShKwcuhw.text: Was craving for Machaca con Huevo's this morning!  This is the first time I've been here for Breakfast, no lines no wait!!!  Freshly made tortilla as usual.

UgZFPWdaaO99OKK15oSAOw.text: This place is so overrated!!  I'm concerned that some are actually delusional enough to consume this food. Friends of mine raved about how delicious everything on this menu was, so I walked in with such high hopes, only to be compeltey let down. All was bland and needed salt, and flavor all together. If I could give a half star, I would.

AqugDHREOGhqack79I0kdQ.text: My favorite Mexican food! I always order  a machaca potato and extra cheese burro. The cheese quesadillas and tortillas are delicious too. I like to wash it down with some of their horchata. I am not a fan of eating at the restaurant as it's a little ghetto but it is very clean. I recommend calling in the order since it gets really busy sometimes.

9uVVZpdkjKPliUJ3uzaXDw.text: Decent food for the price, I was not thrilled with the physical eating area, but then again, it was not Scottsdale. Best tortillas in town, bar none

xCVslt867KDKStURltOPFg.text: A classic hole in the wall mexican restaurant and a Phoenix icon. Known best for their machaca and their hot, freshly made flour tortillas. Good food at great prices. For a photo of the best chimichanga in Phoenix and a full review, check out my blog post: blog.phosyzzle.com/carol...

Tz54y_bBMPeR9WlBApERpg.text: This place has some of the best chimichangas in Arizona.  I love how crappy the building is because it makes the food so much better. I think pretty much everyone I have ever taken to this place got nervous about what was about to happen at first glimpse of the building.  All have left happy to know the place existed and instant fans of the food.

tpO-xabRxwaA8ENvr0W16A.text: I ate here for lunch today and had a green chile burrito.. YUM! The cashier was kind of rude and not very friendly though :(  That is the only reason I did not give 5 stars. Coming from a customer service background ,it is important to be professional and friendly. But the food gets 4 starts!

eZnqppj_4SV0sv6kA32MYA.text: Great yelp find again! This is a must go to place once you land in PHX and before you depart as well. The tortillas are awesome/piping hot fresh and the food was better than most mexican places I normally go to in Cali. free refills on all drinks even the mexican drinks. Try the machaca plate or the chimichanga.

nDMpF1gF3IwJxgc2cmdhRQ.text: Carolina's: My go-to mexican place, hands down. I have been to this place many times, and I will keep going back. My way of judging a Mexican food place is by the Tortilla. If they have a delicious, self-made, fresh tortilla, things are promising and that is exactly what Carolina's has. They have their awards on the wall for all the times they have been voted Best Tortilla in Phoenix, in case you don't wanna take my word for it.  On to the food. I absolutely LOVE the food here! I have yet to try anything here that I didn't love. The tacos don't come in these pre-shapen, dried out, hard shells like some other places. You can see some of the grease on it form the very recent deep-frying, and it is perfectly crisp without being dried out. The meet is always cooked perfectly. I have never ordered something and been disappointed by dried out meat. Some of my favorite things here are the chimichanga and hard-shell beef tacos, which is shredded beef, not the crappy ground junk that a lot of places use. The Chimichangas have to be my favorite, though. I have never had a chimichanga this great. Be careful, though, because the inside of it is REALLY HOT. You will burn yourself if you don't let it cool a little. I would love to talk about the taste of the food more, but I'm making myself too hungry, so I'll move on.  The best part about Carolina's is the price. You cannot beat the price for the quality of food you get. Tacos are all $0.75, all the time! I guarantee you will be filled up from tacos before you feel like you spent too much on them, and you won't be disappointed with the taste! I can't remember the exact price for the chimichangas, but I do remember that it is much less than you will pay anywhere else, and much more delicious!  The location isn't the best, but who cares. The best stuff is always hard to find! If you don't think it's in a safe area and that is what's deterring you, don't let it. There are cops in and out of there all the time to eat. Plus, nobody wants to pull any crap here because it's just too good!  EDIT: Tacos are not $0.75 anymore. I guess they are up to $2.00 now. New price is disappointing, but this doesn't change my rating because they are still the best tacos around!

SyxC7TVU6Pf4sKoZFUum7A.text: Four stars for this wonderful little hole in the wall kind of place.  The location is a little out of the way and I came in for lunch which is okay as there is a very varied crowd.  From longsleeved office workers to utility company uniformed types to gold chained and tatooed tough looking chaps, this place has it all.  Fret not because everyone's here for the good food :).   I had a machaca plate and I like it very much.  The beef was nicely cooked, juicy and tender and full of juices.  The tortillas are home made and very elastic.  Yes elastic, cause u can pull on it and it will stretch, it's almost a little rubber band like.  Unlike most tortillas at other places that simply tears off and crumb when u pull on them, this one will flex with your pull :)  I will be back for sure, can't wait to try their green chili burro :)

F_OA8IG1LJEmFPJEv8eHyA.text: This is what I would call a Phoenix Institution. Having eaten here many times over the span of 20+ years the food has never changed. Great food at great prices. Note they do close at 7pm most nights so get there early for dinner. Also get some fresh Tortilla's to go you will not regret it.

tKqpHhABBBbxu8Fz7A0rgQ.text: To call this place a dive would be too flattering. it's a dump! What isn't filthy or broken is missing ,like good food How this place is in business is a mystery to me. Are there no health inspectors in that part of town?

eVBqkMwR9xXEwOkZQdnBbw.text: Good food - horrible service. I have been a loyal customer for the last 15 years. Their food has consistently been good but the service has been deteriorating. The last 6 times that I have placed an order for an event, my order has not been ready by the time I was told. Recently, we ordered dozens of tamales about 5 hours in advance. We arrived and they had forgotten about our order once again. The women at the front, didn't seem to care and never apologized. Half hour later, we were still waiting. We had to cancel the order and called Comedor Guadalajara right down the street. They were amazing and saved the day. I shared this story with many people at the event and it was recommended that I write a Yelp review. It's with great regret that I say I will not go back to Carolinas again.

BYcmkq98v9FrKwoXvb8Y1A.text: Concerning Flautas (4.00) very small basically two rolled small  tacos. In my opinion not worth it. Try something else.

15y8zWvO2Er2wbTeEce5nw.text: The food is good, really good! But I must be truthful and admit that I really only drop in for the tortillas. These are the most amazing tortillas I've ever eaten. I was raised on Mexican food, having lived in the Phoenix area for over 44 years. These are hands down the best tortillas around. Do yourself a favor, stop in and pick up two dozen flour tortillas. A good portion of the first dozen will likely be consumed on your way home. Then don't waste them making burros, rather lay one out on a cookie sheet, spread a sparing quanitity of shredded cheese on one half and fold the bare half over the cheese. Now place under the broiler set to low until a few golden brown blisters appear. Remove and flip the entire  tortilla over and return the the broiler until this side looks like the first. Remove, slice and enjoy a little slice of heaven right there in your very own kitchen... mmmmm... Yep, they're THAT good... Now excuse me, I've gotta make a Carolina's run for a few dozen...

0ICLteyePJM1T52lcE6Ydg.text: I have a very hard time believeing this place warrants all of the high praise.  Maby the dining in experience is better.  My review is based on a catering order of breakfast burritos that my company did.  The burritos were poorly labled and was difficult to tell which ones did not have nasty chorizo in them.  The burrito I had a bite of and spat out was a salty, greasy mess.  Of course I picked a burrito with chorizo.  So glad I did not waste any calories on this.

5dAo_WtnUDNlk1fCBO5Heg.text: *** I gave this 5 stars based on the best Mexican food I've had in AZ, not based on white linen and waiter service, just an fyi*** I won't write too much as it seems that everyone already has. Both locations are GREAT. Some of the best "homestyle" Mexican I've ever had. I usually get the double wrapped enchilada combo that is pure saucy heaven! A great place to call ahead on a friday night when you're exhausted from work and not doing jack, pick up your food, pick up a six pack of Pacifico and head on home. Happiness is a sure bet!

X4krnKO5PwX1DayxXuYn8w.text: May look like a dump I a bad neighborhood, but this place is always packed at lunch. Hands down, my favorite Mexican joint north of the border

7Oechjw5NsA_QpF6THxRYg.text: I don't understand what is so great about this place. I got the tacos and it was one of the worst that I ever had. I just moved here and still searching for a great taco place.

E4SAOH5H7UIRuAVbIyewHA.text: I cannot say enough about Carolina's. By far the best Mexican joint in town. It's nothing to write home about in terms of atmosphere, but that's part of the experience.  My favorite foods: - Any burrito, enchilada style with red sauce. Like everyone says, the tortillas are absolutely the best anywhere and that red sauce cannot be beat. - Chorizo anything. - The chips and salsa. I always buy an extra bag of chips to take home and the salsa is phenomenal. - Chocolate chimichangas. Small but oh so good.  Try this one or their location in North Phoenix. You will be beyond impressed.

_TMFYd1tNDd2BAdKMz86Xg.text: The Carolina's in Peoria, AZ is run by anti-white Mexican American gang bangers. They sneer at you when you walk up to the counter to place your order.  Don't get me wrong, the food is excellent. The counter service is terrible and there must be half a dozen vatos standing around doing absolutely nothing. The management at the original Phoenix location needs to take a drive out to Peoria and see just why customers are not returning here.

u4NoJn8-xOueyExbJBGzFw.text: Bottom line-food excellent and restaurant kind of gross.  We opted to take our food out.  Possibly the best Mexican I've ever had. Beware of the soda machines-the dispenser stuck, so I ended up getting some hibiscus soda on my pants :(  Anyway, excellent food that you can bring home or make a picnic of it.

vY3yJd-9sncllK2SVZ0jpA.text: This place is a dive in every sense of the word.  Don't let the seedy location put you off in going here.  This may very well be the best, and most authenticate Mexican food I've had anywhere.  The enchilada sauce is bomb!  If you love Mexican cuisine, the is must in your places to go eat.

WX9LI_BraqGk00gC22jQJw.text: Quick, fast and cheap.. and decent food for the price, service and ambiance oopsI mean a no ambiance but hey they have the best tortillas in town and those hole in the wall places have the best food sometimes... In this case it was delish!  I don't mind that it was dirty!  LOL!  Had the Machacha Burro and it was all shredded beef but damn it was good for 3.50.  I can understand why the place is packed to the gills during lunch as I had been working near the airport and nothing too exciting around there without driving too much further during a short lunch break.  Friends ordered beef tacos and cheese enchaladas and said they were great!  Will visit again!

WWeAvyeIofTVGmq3OI42-Q.text: This it the place to get the best flour tortillas in town.  Huge, thin, and perfect for a snack in the car (while they are still warm from the griddle) and then my favorite quesadilla with the little containers of their hot sauce- with little seeds and lots of flavor.  You will be the perfect guest if you take tortillas on the plane to your host...and you will be the envy of the flight if you have lunch to go.

W_0KPdRs24IjJZWF2DiHfQ.text: Had the chimichanga combo.  Was the bomb.  Total dive, but will definitely eat there again.

wwqwpV6cwC_FVFwhNjVtpw.text: If you're looking for real Mexican in a hurry this is your place. This is one of places ill always bring out of town guests who can't find good Mexican. Now its not the best Mexican food in town, but its cheap, easy and a great take out. The tortillas are unbeatable and the chimichanga is what's up. Make sure you grab a butter tortilla for the ride home to hold you over while you smell all that delicious food.

bUF4pobd6_QiF9XBjfzDeA.text: A Christmas Eve tragedy! My husband purchased 1 dozen green corn tamales and a half dozen green chicken tamales for Christmas Eve. So here it is Christmas Eve and we just unpacked the order to discover we only have 11 green corn tamales -- no chicken tamales at all. Very very very bad! He said they were very disorganized when he was there, bad service. I will only go to the Cave Creek location from now on. Merry freaking Christmas!

9xs1Ia73ZVgesguNnLs-rg.text: Best Mexican food in town! Everything is delicious! Make sure you buy a dozen tortillas to take home.

BgS27qszPu9qK0OQaUVwaA.text: One of my favorite Mexican places to eat in Phoenix.  this is definitely a lunch place (and very busy)... the exterior has been upgraded recently so it looks kinda nicer...  the atmosphere is different.  you order your food from a window and wait for your number to be called... all seating is on your own and at times it is though to get a seat...  despite all of this the food is excellent and cheap.  If you go you should buy the tortillas to take home... they are HUGE and pretty tasty... the walls are plastered with awards for best tortillas in Phoenix...  I also recommend trying the tacos and burros...

ekSV2yj7ot7yx3htuI-IUw.text: Best Mexican food in town. Not a fancy place but the food is amazing. Take a tortilla home too. You will not be sorry. This last trip I had a Chorizo and bean burrito. So big you can have it for two meals!

sfbEdhtFXg1PsE-wlu_N3A.text: Carolina's is a local neighborhood spot where those in the know travel to munch on tacos, burritos, tamales, etc. The restaurant isn't much to look at - bars on windows, busy counter where you can look in on tortilla making and the assortment of booths and table/chairs. There is a big line of hungry patrons and people jockeying for tables so that was good news.   You will find the MOST amazing homemade flour tortillas here! They are chewy, soft and sensuous. This is the stuff dreams are made of. I haven't had a tortilla like this in years and may have to make sure I stop through Phoenix more frequently. Pretty much everything my friends and I tried were awesome. Green corn Tamales, tacos with beef, machaca plate with beans and rice and burrito stuffed with chorizo and potatoes. The beans and rice are perfect - you can't overlook those staples. I think I even noted some lard - perfection! Writing this review is making my mouth water - I could really go for some Carolina's now.

ZkP9ofZ_ka07JMOnZYcCTw.text: Well, tortilla was fresh. I ordered the chorizo and potato burrito. The chorizo appeared to be ground beef and was bland. The salsa wasn't very good either.  In fact, I'm going to Adrian's #2 in Mesa off Main Street now to have an egg chorizo and potato burrito and some homemade salsa Keep trying carolinas.

qvdi8O8D826eX4wSG08kGw.text: The crispy beef tacos here are really really good. Take it from someone who knows tacos. They don't skimp on the beef and they give you just the right amount of lettuce. You know how some places will bombard you with lettuce to make it look like it's this amazingly huge taco and when you bite into it, you're left thinking WTH? I'm I being punked? Not here.    I should have taken pictures of my crispy beef tacos and buttered tortilla, but my hunger go the better of me and now I'm ashamed. I think I inhaled the food, I'm still unsure. I wanted to show you all just how great they look, but alas, I can't. You're going to have to try this for yourselves. Take the journey here or forever regret it.

91mPFVMvBNinKjZ2LG1vOA.text: This place is a dive/ hole in the wall but the food is great. Nothing fancy but good comfort Mexican food. My buddy brought me here. It's a hidden gem in Phoenix. The handmade tortillas rock!

8cnwOYCRJVy4YCf6P-5xyw.text: Home made flour tortillas, great 3-way burrito and the rice and beans are really good! I didn't care for the machaca taco salad so much (machaca was good just not on the taco salad she'll) but I don't need to order that anymore. Gonna try other items.

qzaDcTOX0UKGQ072QG_fqA.text: I've been going to the north phx location for years but my boyfriend is a first timer so we came to this one on our lunch break. This location is more bare bones, no frills then the other but the food did not disappoint! We got a green chili burrito that was a bit messy to eat but the flavor was awesome! We also got the combo number 3 that comes with a taco, enchilada, tostada and rice just so he could get a little taste of everything. Their enchilada sauce is great and their tortillas are to die for. Can't wait to come back!

BO28KEORFNeB-Nj4K2PWYg.text: Today I give it Two stars.  My oaxaca special burrito is more like a papas burrito with a touch of beans and a hint of chorizo.  Not good or consistent from visit to visit.  Stick with the footlong from now on.

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Puro papas

TJHaM0HyB_pDDGNZxnxTTA.text: I was expecting a lot more based on the reviews.   I ordered a green Chile burrito with beans, what I got could be described as a bean burrito with little else in it.  The tortillas were so thin and the burrito was wrapped so lose that just picking the thing up already had the tortilla ripping. After the first bite I just gave up on picking it up since the bottom had completely ripped open.  I ended up having to eat it with a fork and a knife, which would've been fine if the food was anything special, but the flavor wasn't any better than the chain mexican food I could get anywhere.

nT__Ueq7TcaIV2eMWmFMhQ.text: I can see how the menu could be hit or miss, which explains the varying reviews. But sometimes, I think a place should be evaluated on a subset of the items. You might ask "Well, why even offer them?!"  You're right, but in practice, I think the subset philosophy works well.   Which brings to me to their Machaca. Outstanding. Just outstanding. Machaca mix has t going on. Sometimes the burro is a bit too wet, and sometimes the tortilla is a bit thin and the burro breaks. But even with those, it's still an excellent meal.  Machaca yourself!

mUa30O8H6au6SDMvXsHIow.text: Stopped in for a quick lunch after picking up our rental car. Definitely recommended!  I had the machaca mix burrito - yum!  My dining partner had the chorizo and potato burrito - also very good. It's a total dive, but the food is excellent!

Mn97WAvBVZUvW8dZHLmSUQ.text: This place is always amazing! Super busy most Of the time even if you order ahead but never ever disappointed. Best tortillas in the Phoenix area and if you're from Gina closest thing to me. Gs or chile pepper you'll find!!!!

ujAL3D6gApi78v5-eLxGIQ.text: This has been here since i was a little kid and after church Sunday's my granny would take us!! Its such a homey feeling and the food is amazing and piping hot and fresh asf

_IguGiq9znBBjQyip11Fog.text: I will give it a definate 4 stars for the food. Their tamales are the most juiciest I've ever tasted, nothing compares.  The recipie for their beef tamales is something you cannot get at a fast food Mexican restaurant.  Their butter tortillas are the best. Although nothing compares to the ones my mom used to make, these are the best I've had. Ever.  The actual resturaunt is kind of run down, there's no paint on the walls, the inside is honestly blah, but I guess it doesn't matter because every time I go in the place, there's a line, but it goes fast.

3u5Lb0GxLaMdEcE29hhAdg.text: Great tortillas, and the green & red burritos are the best! The tacos & tostadas would be my next pick. A must try if you are in the area

PpQKr0XIHBfDH_A4A_I4SQ.text: So once again, I ordered the wrong thing. I must have. Everyone loves this place, so it must be me. Most Yelp reviews are great (which is why we met there), the people I was with loved their food (a burro & a chimichanga), the various police officers who swiftly came in and out seemed to enjoy their food, but I thought mine sucked! This smarts, particularly because I was so looking forward to eating "good Mexican in a sketchy neighborhood," as I had told my cousin weeks ago was high on the to-do list for our trip to Phoenix.   The barbed wire behind the building, the rugged neighborhood, and the jammed paper towel dispenser in the restroom sure made it seem sketchy enough to be good, but the food disappointed me. So what gives?  Does it serve me right for not ordering off the giant menu on the wall?   I asked if they could make enchiladas verdes and they said yes, so I went for it. The chicken, by the by, was fantastic--very white and tender and it looked great, especially in my cousin's burro, but the sauce on my enchiladas was not green, it was more of a MRSA-discharge yellow. In addition, the sauce was so creamy that it was goopy, it was flavorless, and it was not hot. (Er, it was not hot temperature-wise, nor was it spicy).  My cousin ordered chips and salsa with her burro (an enormous bag), so after I finished picking the chicken out of the enchiladas, I ate some of her chips using my refried beans as a dip. The salsa was good, though, and the kind of spicy that accumulates and sneaks up on you. Also, their pop machine dispenses horchata.  Still, I would not go to Carolina's again.

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States. enchiladas verdes
Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States. chimichanga

NYo0V4TrGZOfbYK7fFiPCA.text: This is our downtown go-to!! Go with very low expectations-- the eating area leaves much to be desired!!! It's a DIVE, in every sense. Words cannot describe. It's downright scary. The menu is hard to read & understand, but the food--- the food is amazing!!! Real, True Mexican food!!!! The tortillas are the GREATEST, especially when fresh. The salsa is so good too. Tonight I had the shredder beef burrito. I'm craving another at this very moment!!!

qp7LioxGZAo5zD9SSBMOyw.text: Please don't let the location and appearance discourage you from trying this place.  Homemade tortillas are great, truly authentic taste to everything.  Bean and Cheese burritos will keep us coming back everytime we visit Phoenix...Those of you from Barstow this is the Platas of AZ..

BsAsWjg1AbNpfpMno_A-yQ.text: Carolina's is a hole in the wall in all the best ways. Food is delicious and inexpensive. Service is friendly and relatively fast. FYI the red sauce packs heat so if you don't like spicy, order without this sauce. I happen to enjoy a little flavor kick so it was a pleasant surprise.  The restaurant is set up with a counter to order and pick up with a separate room with tables and chairs to eat. Carry out is offered but no delivery.  When your food is ready they call your order number over a microphone for you to pick up.  Park on the side away from the main road as it may be difficult to get back out. Parking on the main street is only supposed to be for compact cars but I saw several large pick up trucks.  Overall a good experience.

photos.caption: Photo of The Original Carolina's Mexican Food - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Taco and enchilada combo (does not come with drink).

IlzWe6cCwclnsrTwo6noAQ.text: NEVER EVER JUDGE A BOOK BY IT'S COVER. I arrived at sunset, with an hour to spend with my nephew in Phoenix , after landing at Sky Harbor. I wanted real, authentic Mexican food. We arrived at sunset, drove in a questionable neighborhood. Yes, we were scared. Honestly, I fit in most environments, tho. I told the young lady it was my first time there. She provided me with many suggestions. I went with the chicken taco and chicken enchilada. I know. Boring. Wrong!! The taste and texture were amazing. Did I mention, they make fresh tortillas there? People, get out there, relax, enjoy what this restaurant has to offer. I don't give a damn that this is in a bad neighborhood!!! It's about exploring, savoring and unbiasly enjoying what each community has to offer. YUM

FP2FYRB8LjQhZkfNHfOA5A.text: I guess by now all you people are so used to the crappy Mexican in phoenix that you think this is the max.  I guess to each his own but my Idea of good Mexican is not soggy tortillas, food that tastes like cumin a trashy dump that is not clean, there is no way you can clean a place like this they make enough money to at least put in a decent floor, but trust me you eat what you see.

LewE135O2RuTZSJDIDXLWw.text: If you find yourself hungry once you have landed in Phoenix, you should visit this place. The food is fresh and very good. Like other reviewers have said, don't judge by the outside or even by what's inside until you get your food. I love eating at places where I can tell the locals are arriving in herds....

k_OiDmbYDirT3Cv0ZrmlWg.text: Seriously Carolina's? This place is not at all what I expected it to be. It's busy. There was a line bigger than the restaurant... But super disappointing once my food arrived... 45 minutes later. I got a machaca burrito (apparently that's what the rave was about) and was completely dissatisfied. My husband had the shredded beef tacos and a green tamale (dry with sweet masa, BLEH). Nothing to write home about. I've been searching far and wide for an authentic Mexican food place and these Arizona places are nothing compared to the real food back home in the streets of LA! You people have no idea what good food is... Sorry.
